orVtBjUNkLIMRXPsuERLfw.text: So much more than expected! Yes a wait but we were there on a holiday weekend. Good beer selection, amazing Bloody Mary...the drink part was good as was the accompanying sausage, pickle, bacon, peppers, and olives. The ahi tuna wonton/tacos were delicious and not too fried, loved the chicken wings, and the Greek salad had olives, hummus, garbanzo beans, carrots and more. The staff was super friendly. We would eat there again for sure.

e20QHzkfWbxJRiSaZDhLwQ.text: Turkery burger with smoke gouda cheease was the highlight. Everything else fell short.

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkey burger mmmmm

BpI4FVFPnRmlJxkXg4oTVA.text: Service - some good, some awful  Food - Ok, nothing great  I sat at the bar for lunch, which was a little more than half full.  Unfortunately there was only one bar tender working, and she was having to move very fast to try to keep up with everything going on.    I ordered an appetizer and a sandwich - after about 15 minutes the sandwich arrived, but no appetizer.  The runner called over the bar tender, and they offered to take the sandwich back and keep it warm until I was ready for it - I said no, I would take the sandwich and they should take the appetizer off the bill.  After I was done with the sandwich and fries, waiting for check, the appetizer came out, and tried to get me to take it to go.  I was out for the day, and I wasn't going to leave the food in the car on a 100 degree day to spoil.  The cajun sandwich was tasty, but greasy and too messy - plan on having several pieces falling out of the sandwich (and chances are down your shirt)  was a disappointment to say the least

66skEhMCtoexjxkIg6MDKg.text: Lived up to the hype. Burgers had great flavor and were cooked well. Drinks were pricey but good.

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The bacon Mac-n-cheese burger
Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Original Ringer

7M-TeMPP0vWk8xghgGHz7g.text: Being from Northern California my wife and I have always been a big fan of Guy! On this adventure to Las Vegas we tried the breakfast burrito and paired it with a signature Hangover Bloody Mary for brunch. The burrito was fantastic and if you get the chance to stop by ask for our waitress "Shelby." She made the best Bloody Mary that I have had in quite some time! This place has a great atmosphere and we really enjoyed our experience ! A+++ !

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

k-QXYIoUAkRiVKxn483A3w.text: The Original burger was great, as was the atmosphere.   The truffle fries were great too - I enjoyed how there were several different kinds of fries and a variety of flavors.   Great restaurant on the strip!

gj3ehlIdNLpvCDnPDHA8hQ.text: Adrian was so awesome! Literally the best server I've had in a long time. The food was good. Had the Bacon Mac-and-cheese burger, tasted like a normal burger--not OMG amazing but definitely good. But the real reason for this review is because Adrian was damn good! He was friendly, efficient and was just overall pleasant. We appreciated him so much!

hOjKqO3X6SpppC7wZkyRgg.text: Our group ordered the Trash Can Brisket Nachos, the motley que, cajun sandwich, a burger and the big dipper. Everything tasted fine, but nothing special.

b-ScfgzVckeEzD0e84xLwg.text: Love Guy's shows so we wanted to try out his food. I ordered the major of flavortown burger and it was really good!! It's a huge burger and the caraway seed slaw was a great touch! The pastrami really made the sandwich!

A2AauD1uF_LvI-ma04EE-Q.text: Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen and Bar is amazing when it gets it right and overwhelmingly off putting when they misstep.  Some of the details are immaculate: large square ice cubes that reflect the boldness of the atmosphere, custom napkins and silverware, a watermelon gazpacho shot advertised to cleanse your palette that delivers and refreshes.  With such care put in, why are the home fries from a frozen bag mix? Why does the waitstaff act inconvenienced at having to work the morning shift and need to be requested to serve your coffee before your order arrives?  Perhaps the hit and miss attitude is reflective of counting on the clientele to be hung over.  And, it is great hang over food. The chicken fried bacon biscuits and gravy was an event in my mouth. I've never had chicken fried bacon and it elevates the dish. I had the equivalent biscuits and gravy at Hash House A Go-Go earlier this week and Guy Fieri's knocks it out of the park.   My partner's basic breakfast of eggs, sausage, and home fries was okay. The biscuit was delicious and the apple chicken sausage was delightful, but overall I would pass on this.   Come not expecting a culinary experience and leave with a full, happy stomach.

ybLDcNju88UgD2mokswy4g.text: I was a big fan of Guy Fiery and his shows on food network until I visited his own restaurant . The only good thing  about it was that our server was nice and smiling.  We ordered wings and they were dry and extremely salty. We ordered his original ringer hamburger and a vegetarian  burger. Not impressed at all. The bun was dry. The coleslaw in the burger overpowered the taste of the patty.   The fries as side were nothing great too. There was nothing about the food that could ever  make us go back to his restaurant.  Considering he is from Vegas and runs such successful shows  on TV , his own food needs lot of work and improvement. Basic food like wings and burger...who gets it wrong?  This place is way too overpriced for the dry tasteless food we got to eat last night. It is off our list.

5IfSHRBpCYPeZD0tzzgylg.text: First, while $$ may mean entrees in the 10-30 range,  21 bucks for a hamburger and side salad puts it in the $$$ range.  That is EXPENSIVE for a hamburger.  The food here is HEAVY  and GREASY.  The platters look huge when the server brings them. I had the "Mayor of Flavortown" burger.  It  had pastrami on it. It also had coleslaw and some sort of deep fried onion and somewhere down at the bottom an overcooked beef patty. They allow the grease from the patty to soak into the bottom bun, yuk, instead of properly draining the burger.   The menu said swiss cheese also, but if it was in that gelatinous mess, it had no flavor.   These are not hamburgers, these are some monster creation, flavorless concoctions of garbage, with a garnish of overcooked beef and a grease filled bun.  When I have a burger, I want to taste the beef.  Sorry to have to write this I was expecting better.  I asked for Balsamic Vinegar and oil for the salad.  They brought them mixed together so it was impossible to get the mix of oil and vinegar that I liked.  Also, if they paid a dollar a gallon for that vinegar, they overpaid.  It was HARSH.  On the plus side, the napkins were great. the waitress was very pleasant, the "food" came out quickly.

uqIZEN21TlTyIeGYT8Ji-A.text: Trash can Nacho's are simply amazing. This is a must stop everytime we are in Vegas!!

7W6Dw0Iku81G2RzC2Fl4UA.text: This restaurant is delicious! The waitress is super friendly and personable. I cannot wait to visit Vegas again to come back!!

BjcdlG-N3Fu1-K8BqDewEg.text: My friends and I ate there last night (4 of us) and everyone single one of us felt very sick after dinner. I threw up 5 minutes after the meal, my friend threw up later that night and the others had stomach aches all night. The 2 of us that threw up had the mac and cheese burger and the other 2 had ribs and a sort of sandwich. The burgers were also really not flavourful. Not sure what was wrong with our dinner but it was a really bad experience.

1JYAo3vpNZcBPuiChu5x2A.text: After being told that the wait time is 30 minutes, my girl friend and I waited an hour and 15 minutes. I actually timed it. To us Customer Service is everything to us. Our drinks took 20 minutes to come even though we order 2 beers in a bottle (not that hard to bring out as no one is making it) or maybe they were in the back based on how long we had to wait.

t8-pn7-1jieNlyYA65WMPA.text: Burgers are alright but the trash can nachos!! Oh my gosh they are phenomenal and the serving size is definitely to share! The service was a little off when I went on a weekday but still had a great time!

0GVIZE67ArrEbnrHmCkBOQ.text: We love watching Guy's TV shows but this place is any thing but " flavor town " we were very disappointed with the food and service. We won't be back if your looking for a awesome breakfast place in Las Vegas go to Hash House a Go Go much better. Sorry Guy but you've missed it with this place.

kLJp4VAZD-ZxPq5BqN4_gA.text: Loved the bacon Mac and cheese burger!! So good!! Only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because the Fireball Wings were not good. I gave it a good ole college try. I ate two and couldn't stomach any more. The dipping sauce it came with though was great! I'd recommend this place and I would come back but not for those wings.

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IYG314l1cL5MmdaKDJqe2w.text: This restaurant was okay. The food came out quick but the servers seemed like they hated their jobs. I ordered the bacon Mac and cheese burger. It was pretty dry. I feel like it needed some sort of sauce or something. My boyfriend ordered the pulled pork sandwich. It was sooooo good. Their Ranch tasted like sour cream. lol. The Asian waitress with the red hair looked mad the whole time. While she was cleaning the tables. She was helping one of the tables in front of me and i guess the customer asked for something and as she was walking away she said something to herself and rolled her eyes. Maybe her customers didn't see it, but other people could.

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

K9_O9NjcGibMDlUv0LWnEw.text: While scrolling through Yelp looking for a place to eat, Guy Feiri's Restaurant definitely caught my eye. I glanced at the menu and saw that they had something for everybody in my group, so I picked that for our lunch destination. I'm vegan, so I was delighted to see that they had a veggie burger. I avidly LOVE Guy and was so excited to taste his food. The atmosphere was charming, and the waitresses were adorable. We were promptly seated and the service was quick.   I ordered the veggie burger, with no cheese, mayo, etc. so, the waitress caught on to the fact that I don't eat animal products. She then told me that the veggie patty has egg and cheese in it!:( she felt really bad, but I assured her that it wasn't her fault. So there I was, the person who chose the restaurant, eating a small side salad with lemon vinaigrette dressing. So sad. The rest of my party totally enjoyed their food, but I was so bummed that there weren't any vegan options! I would LOVE to see a vegan burger here in the future, especially during the year 2016 where people are beginning to wake up to the truth about animal agriculture. Guy, please make a vegan option or two!

yEmxJhBkmq8oZvwjivl55w.text: Husband had the GUYS original burger. Great presentation it looked wonderful when it was delivered to the table all the dressings but the burger was a McDonald's size patty. Hey Guy,  where's the beef ??

OJia98wl9N7r8ca7e1wK-Q.text: Stopped in here for breakfast before heading home and was pleasantly surprised.  Rather than the typical breakfast, it was elevated to another level.  Instead of regular breakfast sausage, it came with apple chicken sausage.  Instead of a typical biscuit, it was served with a delicious buttermilk sage biscuit.  And while the potatoes were a bit overcooked, they were topped with grilled peppers and onions.  In addition to the food, it came with a watermelon gazpacho to cleanse the palette...nice touch.  Overall, I was pretty impressed with the breakfast and would like to return to try a burger.

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wuJxMs9MmO3h4FbLAYd9Ug.text: We enjoyed the food here so much that we came twice during our stay at The LinQ!  The Trash Can Brisket Nachos are AMAZING!!!  It's definitely a sharable item.  Another must are the Quad Fries!  The variety of sauces that come with the fries were a nice touch to the fries, but they are so nicely seasoned that eating them alone are still good! The portions of the food are huge and could definitely be shared!  I ordered the mac and cheese burger, which was delicious, but couldn't finish it because I went crazy with the nachos. This will be a stop for all future Vegas trips in my book!

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Trash Can Brisket Nachos do not disappoint!
Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac &amp; Cheese Burger
Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Quad fries on point!

fG-mjiXxR3bDbozolZnjcw.text: My sister & I went here for dinner before a magic show. Rad decor, just like Guy. The brisket nachos were very good, but very heavy & greasy. HUGE portion that we shared. Really good Arnold Palmers. Kind of a greasy, beer food type place. I would have liked to have seen more options, but what we got was good.

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket nachos

0qxvqVwWp7M7lvnt5EAkGA.text: Mac and cheese burger. Omg!!!! Bestt burger I've ever had in my life. Tender, flavorful, juicy and the bacon in it was crispy binding the entire burger to its perfection. The BBQ wings were ok. Fries were great too. Fries were flavorful, crispy outside yet soft inside.

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BBQ wings. Fresh meat and subtle BBQ flavor. Meat was not hard but nothing too bad.
Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac and cheese burger. Omg!!!! Bestt burger I&#39;ve ever had in my life.

QpPOA1CnfADf3Z5PqKVt7g.text: My husband and I chose to eat here on our recent Vegas visit. We had a short wait and then we were seated at a table inside. Our waitress was prompt with a greeting and to take our drink orders. She was a very good server and provided anything we needed. My husband ordered the ribs that came with fries and i got wings. The food came out fast. He said the ribs were very good, just not the best he ever ate. The wings were small, like wing-dings. They were not served with any sides, just wings. The bbq sauce was very good, but again, not the best I ever had. The meal was over $60.00, we didn't have any alcohol, just pop and ice tea.  Overall it was a good meal but one we could have got at any chain restaurant for much less. We probably will not visit again.

Vr_WgG0RYk6XiROed4ZnSg.text: This place is always good, always has a line and never disappoints. It's one of the few places I get an appetizer meal and a dessert at lunch. I'm not sure how many locations they have but when I travel this is a must visit on my trips.   We start off with the Vegas fries, what a great concept and it was served with a Wasbi- Blue Cheese dressing first time I ever had that.  I had the Big Dipper a roast beef sandwich and again a great item to order.   For dessert we split the 7 layer chocolate cake and a glass of milk, o yeah my wife loved her Turkey Picnic Sandwich as well.  No Guy siting but it is Black Friday so maybe he's out shopping.

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New, 7 layer chocolate cake, yes it is very yummy!
Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I&#39;m not done just thought I would snap before I ate the plate

BV4Jd12wWTL6qnm0oaXxVA.text: The appetizers are massive, and the desserts are definitely worth ordering. Four people split three appetizers and a dessert, with plenty left over. Prices were well below anything else we ordered on the strip, and for the portion sizes you definitely got your money's worth. Get the truffle fries, they are incredible! And the fried ice cream sundae is to die for!

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle fries- the best fries I&#39;ve had!
Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried ice cream sundae

u_6D4DQ4Spfo-UVHsU3HKg.text: Guy's strategy. Take southern food, put endless amounts of cheese on it, or fry it. Then serve cold.  Service was really good though. Food was not very good, at least not for a featured Las Vegas restaurant. I would recommend spending your money elsewhere

DPCRhivTNmerjoXDCu3v7w.text: Not impressed. Had breakfast there and the carne asada dish was just so so. The fried tortilla pieces under the meat got soft and gooey with the sauce and was nasty to eat. I picked out the meat and ate that. What a letdown after being so excited to eat there. The two stars are for the waiter. He was nice and attentive.

YOz330oaKDRJPWG1EA6tiQ.text: Great food, good drinks, great atmosphere. Lively sports bar. Good music. Bartenders are playful and fun. Real nice place.

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-fpluk-TOEgGPqKsmmahhw.text: A shame it has his name . The food was not great. Service was slow . It is popular you will wait we did for an hour to be disappointed.

oxwapYsKNzmixahVUBYj_A.text: We enjoyed the atmosphere and the Mac & Cheese Bacon Burger. You definitely pay for it but very good. If you're on the strip nearby check it out

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wUGdwJRDJCE3zRzN-BjwDg.text: Took my sister here for the first time, raving about their trash can nachos I had last year. I had it last year and it was awesome, but couldn't remember whether it was beef or pork, only that it was "pulled" or shredded. The description on the menu said it was "pulled pork." It arrived and the cheese was in chunks and appeared it hadn't had time to fully melt. The meat was "diced" rather than pulled and was black and hard, like it was old and recycled. And the chips tasted stale. When I brought it to the server's attention, he kindly offered to replace it with a new one. New one was much the same. This time, I showed the server the dark, diced meat and asked if it's supposed to be like that, not pulled as described on the menu and he said no. He recommended we order something else as replacement would most likely be same. It was quite disappointing especially when I was very excited to share it with my sister. The rest of the food was good. It is pricey, but that's to be expected when you're on the strip in Vegas dining at a "branded" establishment.

hcZRjFhKrrZNM8gvGXSQeQ.text: This place was really good. The burger was juicy,the fries were heavily seasoned to perfection, and all my friends enjoyed their food. The service was a little shotty compared to the good but not bad enough to ruin the experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon Mac N Cheese Burger

nxhWRqNz1d-DbkvxsLluGQ.text: Overall great experience.  We arrived around 9:30pm on a Tuesday, party of 4. No wait time.  Ordered the lobster pops appetizer (a bit of a let down, lots of batter), the salmon (tasty), the pork emporium platter (lots of food, tasty), and the triple mint pie (this was not a pie at all, basically just ice cream, it was good ice cream, just not what was in the description).  We were all happy with our meal and service but I wouldn't say that the food is really a standout.

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon
Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork emporium
Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cesar salad

vnBtuEBhU96BIv-MSDLyag.text: I wish I could review the food but I can't since we couldn't eat it.  We stopped here while walking the strip, and ordered a couple of drinks and the trashcan nachos without black beans.  Hey, I don't like black beans and I am allowed that.  Anyhow, the first trashcan nachos comes out and we are ready to dig in except...there is a long nasty human hair in it.  We tell the waiter and he is very apologetic and then rushes another order through.  This time it has black beans in it.  At this point we are not that impressed and decide to leave.  I will say that they took our drinks off the bill, which was cool, but 1 hair snowballed into a lot more.  I was really looking forward to them too.  Maybe next time!

nCfxiPzyGRkIl53eto55Ug.text: Always been a Guy Fieri and DDD fan, do had to give this joint a try.  I was a little concerned with only 3 1/2 stars, but I was not disappointed.   It was a late lunch, like 2:30 ish and still a five minute wait. No big.   Service was good and very friendly.   My GF and I shared the lobster lollipops, ahi tacos and shrimp. Zero complaints.   Sure it's pricey, but what in Vegas isn't?

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ahi tacos
Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegas!
Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster lollipops

ENiNXesR_0Q9X1K-VTi7vA.text: Great burger, choice of sides was kinda lame and everything is expensive! No pecan pie!! WTH!?!

2cYcpv5Tj3V8H3fDts0Bqw.text: Although my first visit was not the ideal visit, my wife and I decided to try this place again. We remembered the food was amazing but our service was terrible. However, this visit was much much better.   After walking the strip for a few days, we were starving for a good ole fashion "gourmet" burger with a medley of fries. LUckily for us, this place was known for that and we did really love the food.   It was now lunch time and we decided to bear the wonderful 90 degree sunny desert heat from Belllagio. We walked into the restaurant and was seated right away at the booth.   This visit, our server lady stopped by within 15 minutes and got our drink order. We ordered the ahi tuna tacos again and they were amazing.   I ordered the Prime Time Burger and my wife got the Mac n Cheese burger again. Both did arrive in a reasonable amount of food. Our drinks were refilled before they reached 50% and this server actually checked on us multiple times.   Overall, I am glad we gave this location another shot and we were left happy leaving this location.

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime Time Burger
Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac n Cheese Burger

N2JkpuagvxPw6sG5kBrDRA.text: I was disappointed in Guy's. I was expecting so much "flavor town" and it was very lack luster. My husband and I got the trash can nachos, the famous burger and the mint ice cream skull dessert. Our waitress was nice but we barely saw her. The trash can nachos are not worth it. They were so soggy and had barely any cheese. The burger was okay...nothing special. The ice cream was good, but you can't screw that up. We did find a small piece of plastic in our ice cream, it looked like saran wrap. Maybe that's what the skull was wrapped in? We brought it to our waitresses attention and she said she would let the head cook know. She even took the plastic piece from us but no further action was taken. With all of the places you can eat in Vegas I would skip Guy's.

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tFkX4xSPHUPgivDYw18r2w.text: I have always loved Guy Fieri as a food expert and I was looking forward to trying something spicy, innovative, and memorable. Boy were we disappointed!!!! The menu is largely fried items that you can find anywhere ,basically extremely expensive bar food. My boyfriend and I were not super hungry so we decided to split the $21 Kobe burger and have a small Caesar salad. The burger was very thin, overdone, and tasted like a generic frozen patty.  The Caesar was ok, but not memorable in any way. The only redeeming notes were my boyfriend's margarita and our server, Greg, who was exceptional on a busy day. Guy, I expected way more from you!

TJTx5huhlR73GaMugRVZRw.text: I didn't get a chance to dine in, but I tried calling ahead to place an order for pickup and was told they don't allow phone orders. So, since I was staying at the LINQ hotel, I went to the first floor and placed my order at the bar. I'd been craving chocolate cake and saw Guy Fieri's was the closest place.  I ordered the Whiskey infused chocolate cake to go and coffee while I waited for my order at the bar. The bartenders were on top of everything, super sweet and fun to be around.  This review is only for the cake to be honest. While it was $13, it was worth it in Vegas! The cake was at least 4 layers super rich, chocolatey, and delicious! There are chocolate shavings on the outside and top of the cake and drizzled with whiskey and chocolate sauce.The cake slice is also super huge, so large enough to share with another person, or can be eaten in two servings.  It was the only dessert I had in Vegas and was totally worth it.

i2EKK0A4XlRLvWFyCeUXQw.text: Absolutely in love with this place  the food is amazing and the customer service is off the hook. The outfits that the staff wear are so much fun too. I don't remember our servers names (sorry) because my boyfriend and I were drunk (hence Vegas vacay) and the girl with red hair was so nice when she delivered our burger and trash can nacho. THE TRASH CAN NACHOS LIKE OMG- must try!! I asked her about the Bloody Mary's since the menu told us to haha and she explained the different sizes etc... we don't like Bloody Mary's but ordered one anyways and look at that picture I attached. OMG!!! Our real server came over (guy with black beard and black hair) and explained how they made it extra special for us since we basically ordered the drink for a picture lol boyfriends brother loves Bloody Mary's. What a great experience.   We ended up coming back the next day after a pool party (shit-faced haha) and I remember our server was super nice again. Great service. Don't remember his name but he was tall, dark hair, and very good looking / big muscles (probably a male stripper at night). We got the philly cheesesteak and the steak entree. Steak on steak. The food and atmosphere is great but the customer service was perfect.   I already recommended this place to my friend that's visiting Vegas next month and I will forsure be dining at this restaurant every time I'm in town yay!!

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

I7p54sKLgDc2z-mjT1eSGw.text: 3 stars... We've been here twice and somehow never written a review, well that ends now! Trash can nachos were on the agenda, and they did not disappoint.. now we did have to send them back the first time because they were not warm, but second go round the melty oozy cheese and smoky meat was great! Laura our bartender made everything great and was a fun addition to keep us entertained... We've had the burgers, we've had the salads, and now the nachos, and all were good.  Ambiance is industrial cowpoke, prices are slightly above expectation(but it's Vegas where you aren't supposed to leave with any money, and staff was fab! MILITARY DISCOUNT = BONUS!!  We will surely be back to try something new next go round...

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nachos!

w82ZjTP_93pxRjqUCJk5SQ.text: Outstanding service (I was worried based on other reviews). I had a margarita and lobster tacos. Both excellent(dare I say off the hook?). Fun people watching from the patio. Very specific menu. So look ahead to make sure there will be something you will enjoy. Highly recommend.  Lovely fans overhead on patio make heat bearable. Water glass refreshed regularly by service team. Big thumbs up.

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View of the neighbors from outside seating. Giant fans overhead.

AMSFPtOIdWy3ToXn8xGkKg.text: We loved this menu & location! Great option of beers & plenty of fresh & fruity or sour cocktails. The appetizer menu was greatly priced & even better portions. We sat outside & the breeze was amazing. I wish I would have got a picture of everyone's meal. Our waiter was great to0! Name was Trip

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ultimate Chicken lettuce cups.
Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster tacos

uJFiHPtyOT_XjYMt-Ix-3g.text: Ate there after we checked in at The Linq. Everyone's food was perfect!  No complaints. I'm a celiac and I had no problems finding something to eat.   We were seated right away which was great too.  We will eat there again.

ijBb1ZLnv9MaIHvyi4YaTA.text: Morgan's Greek Salad was super fresh and really good. I liked how you get to cut the salad up yourself. Very cheesy but the Parmesan cheese was so good I couldn't get enough. I ate the whole thing and a little bit of the Baja Bowl which was also very good but a little spicy (mostly rice and beans) but I loved the sauces. Super tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Morgan&#39;s Greek Salad

VQQ1itHCdnEdUdIQu7tfEw.text: We ate dinner here outside on the patio. We were seated immediately and were toasty under the heat elements. My DH ordered a hamburger and I ordered the Hawaiian chicken sandwich. I substituted a small salad in place of the fries. The hamburger was a 5 and my sandwich was a 4. The lemon balsamic salad dressing was very light and refreshing. The hamburger was the best I have ever tasted. My chicken sandwich was good but not exceptional. I actually wasn't thrilled about the pineapple on the sandwich and I like pineapple. The fries had interesting seasonings including barbecue flavorWe really enjoyed the patio because we could people watch and listen to the music from Harrah's. This is a definite location to get an awesome hamburger. The service was fantastic and I highly recommend.   Had a little issue with being seated on our 2nd visit but after we got to our table all was good.

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nachos
Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nczk-b9aJWOtr4SMY1-Ilg.text: So I'm currently sitting here with my bf and am already not impressed. Only staying here because he needs to get food in him and we're already down  The outside menu board had breakfast on there which lured us in (no mention of when it ends). We sat down and were handed lunch menus only. Asked for breakfast and our server wasn't happy about it and proceeded to try to verbalize the menu but I asked twice for it to be handed to us so we could scope it. He wasn't thrilled about and gave us 2 seconds to read it and said we HAD to order NOW.   What kind of BS is this?! We are rushed to order because they can't get their shit together about that time breakfast service ends and are then grumpy when we ask for that specific menu.   We ended splitting a burger which was good. But asked a beer but came like 20 mins later....were they brewing it themselves or something ?!   Overall, could have done without coming here. There are def better places in Vegas with better service.

4C5VGbmfdw2Hz7QN2gSutA.text: I'm a Guy fan but the food was very bland! It was an amazing presentation but bland beyond belief. My wife and I shared the pork emporium platter. It had sausage, ribs, bacon and pulled pork. The pulled pork was dry, sausage was bland, ribs tender but no  flavor and the Mac & cheese was bland! The barbecue sauce was ok but good barbecue tastes good without sauce.   I also purchased the sashimi taco and it was very sweet! It was ok but would not recommend it.   The service was fine. There were a couple "Vegas" tourists being loud but hey it's Vegas! Portions large, meal price ok except the drinks were very expensive.   Unfortunately another famous name put on a restaurant that has fallen prey to marketing over quality of the product. Disappointed.

qWe2JvRRImznczsvo6Hokg.text: Let's get one thing out of the way: Guy Fieri rules.  Sure, he may look like he's perpetually stuck in 2002 and dress like Bowser on vacation at Race Wars from the earlier Fast & Furious movies, but he also appears to be a solid dude who helps out in the community and just really, really loves food. Glass houses, throwing stones, etc.  Let's go to the menu for item names: Jalapeno Pig Poppers Trash Can Nachos The Pork Emporium Chicken Parm-eroni Tatted-Up Turkey Burger Motley Que Pulled Pork Sandwich  How about some of these bon mots in the item descriptions: SMC (super melty cheese) Guy's blue-sabi (blue cheese + wasabi) breaded + fried airline chicken breast "dirty" fried rice donkey sauce donkey sauce donkey sauce the "OG" of sandwiches a liberal slathering of A1 Donkey sauce  I don't know why the last Donkey sauce was capitalized either.  Food and drinks are priced for Vegas. Wait staff and timing was about average. The offerings themselves were very good. Sriracha wings especially were a noteworthy highlight. Had a friend get the Kobe burger and he swears by it. Pulled pork sandwich definitely worth a try.  Look, there are a ton of these type of places littering the strip. At the very least, you know the guy who created this one loves food so much he describes it like a kid on meth.

igMChkbmrRb_Gk0yy-j5CA.text: I'm going four stars over three for two reasons; exceptional service from bartender Laura (June 2019), and for being fairly unique by having some chilled on-tap shot options in not just your run of the mill liquors (chocolate cake, oatmeal cookie, PB&J, white gummy bear).  If it were food alone, I'd stop at three stars because the kobe burger was honestly fairly disappointing; the tuna poke tacos were very good on our first visit, so much so that I returned the next day expecting the burger to be astounding, and it wasn't, while having a price of almost $22.  I do like that you can get the burgers as a lettuce wrap.  The margaritas were great; I prefer the VIP.  They are fairly tart, but our bartenders on both days of our visit were willing to put some extra Grand Marnier in to mellow things out.  The chocolate cake shot is a fun one with a procedure to follow; sugar, drink, lemon, and then the chocolate cake taste kicks in and you're like wow that's really good.  So, fun place, great service, but if you were expecting a superb burger either because of the price or Guy's tv shows / reputation, I didn't think it lived up to expectations.

Z6Tjm-VRG05N9U15WuOC_Q.text: Man, this place is awesome. Swear to god. They served me the best burger I have ever had. It was expensive, but so worth the cost.  I had a fantastic cocktail as well that mixed perfectly. The staff were super friendly and always ready to refill your beverage.

0v2GzL3RXQNu4-rXFGUVBA.text: Let me start with the burger was enough to share. Cooked prefect to order.  Food came out hot and flavorful.  I do not know what was on the fries but I could not stop eating them. My friend didn't care for the seasoning that is why the 4 stars and not five. Service was good. Well worth the try. Better then wahlburgers.

DxOC6ga_FKOXpFuwuHu8aA.text: I recommend this place for a great breakfast. Every bite was delicious. This was well worth the price of $17 a plate or $16 with rewards card for the biscuit and gravy. $14 for the French toast plate. So much food on the plate, couldn't eat it all but we wanted too. Atmosphere is modern mixed with country. Cool napkins with skull on them. Plates have the signature skull embossed on them. Great view of the Mirage from your table  Definitely worth trying

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French toast, bananas foster, sweet bacon hidden in the middle
Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deep fried bacon, gravy , delicious biscuit and scrambled eggs. 5 star dish

UCr-ACgVwtJ3jWCv264gNQ.text: If you are a Guy fan, a foodie, a former fat kid or just plain ol hunger y'all gotta come here. We went twice got Trash Can Nacho, Mac and Cheese Burger and the Motley Crew. First off let's get the fries talked up. About 3 or 4 different cuts of taters, fried right, twice I would guess and seasoned with a light salt,garlic and maybe paprika ??? Not good but great.  Now let's talk about this fine steer that gave his all to donate this fine brisket to the meal. Guy's technicians did the memory of this creature honor. Smoked just right, moist and chopped from 1/2" slices. Just the correct mix of inside and outside meat. Not sure if I have had better? Would need a Pepsi challenge to tell.  Now let's talk sauce. Perfected Guy! Just the right blend of brown sugar/molasses ? Garlic,raisin paste,maybe anchovies and a little clove?  Wait staff were more than friendly and were anxious to pamper. Open concept kitchen clean, modern and well managed.  Overall this formerly fatkid sez this place is borderline 11.

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gSuwfhNaCL61PFzXXVK9Lg.text: People stop whining about waiting. Geeze. This restaurant is in a busy spot in a busy town. Fun to sit outside where you can watch the tourists and showpieces (Spartacus in a speedo, and a nun with her chest hanging out making a few bucks taking pics w tourists).  Our server was not great but we liked the food. My son liked the mac n cheese burger, and my burger was very good too. Almost every table was taking pics of their food - there are some interesting concoctions.  Higher price than I want to pay, but I am on the strip where prices are high. Don't like it? Whine about it or go elsewhere I say.  It was over 100 degrees and they had the mist sprayers going above the patio. When u first sit down it seems a bit much, but in a few minutes it felt good.

PzCgXvuzDz3tfCUSXKH3Ag.text: Great food. Stopped in for lunch and had the Bloody Mary for and appetizer and the trash can nachos. Both were delicious

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GYDUngooJXoh9PguBjMecw.text: I had the original burger (and so did my co-worker) and it was fantastic - one of the best I've ever had.  But the french fries - double thumbs down - cardboard taste, like it was fried a few days before, and fried again, not even warm, it was cold!  What's up with your french fries Guy?  Since I love french fries, this was a huge disappointment for me.

alYS1_Y9eHy2ivYKD47nGg.text: Great food & great service  We had the Mac & Cheese Bacon Burger - so tasty!!! Worth every penny  The Drunken Fish Tacos were also great. The cilantro and house sauce work great together.   My glass of water was never empty, they were very attentive about refills.

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac &amp; Cheese, Bacon, and another slice of melted cheese on top....delicious!

TrQGYtQGzzC4r07dUMzRJg.text: This place really divided my opinion:  The Guy-Talian Fondue Dippers are TO DIE FOR. Such an amazing combination of flavors and textures, I'm planning to attempt to make my own. For the record, they're Snyder's pretzel sticks, wrapped in salami, sprinkled with parmesan and parsley, and served alongside a bowl of fondue. AMAZING. One of my favorite appetizers anywhere.  The burger doesn't crack my top 25. It was actually really disappointing.  And they have frozen shots of Fireball. If you're into that sort of thing.

xeT1eT661bbBLXfIBeK-ng.text: We were excited to try a "guy" restaurant and this place was packed!  It was way below expectations though. The bbq pork sandwich wasn't anything special, and my wife said her wings were just okay. Service was good though and everyone friendly. We just expected a more fresh and unique taste from one of his places. It was like eating at a Chili's or Buffalo Wild Wings. It's okay, good sometimes, but nothing special. Like every other big chain.

AriDu_tF0UkZLeVZFC-JLA.text: Very disappointing. We were expecting more from a big named Food Network personality. The food was mediocre at best and the prices are overrated. I would have rather eaten at the Linq down the street. Save your money and walk on past this restaurant. You can't win them all but we will definitely not be coming back!

Cs-ioxuyZEi_HWo3B0REqw.text: Do you like cold scrambled eggs and a dry brick for a biscuit?  Hey, the turkey sausage was good which is why I gave 1 star.  The bacon was ancient beef jerky. The coffee was days old bitter.  Has Guy Fieri ever eaten here?  I certainly hope not.  He would be so embarrassed.  When the waiter asked how everything was, I couldn't even mutter a lie.  I just stared into his eyes.  Super horrible!

tAIJqwE2LwqMFxpYICPKMg.text: Last meal in Vegas before we have to fly home to idaho.  You know that saying save the best for last?  Well that is the case with Guys restaurant.   Was not disappointed at all.  Even our son said we need to come back here again after eating the drunken fish tacos.  The mac n cheese bacon burger was legit.  Turn into Harras to park and wind your way back to the Quad. Once you Valet park it is right there. Winner winner chicken dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum food was fantastic and full of flavor.  Waiter Nick L made recommendations that were spot on. Coming again for sure.

NFmJuaGwp71i2Ohrwtq7eQ.text: One shot, everything rides on tonight Even if I've got three strikes, Imma go for it, This moment, we own it And I'm not to be played with at...GUY FIERI! - 2 Chainz (we own it)  These burgers are serious business my friends. They forgot to mention that each burger comes with extra napkins! On the menu there's salads, sandwiches, and burgers but for the Guy Fieri experience, I think you gotta go with a signature burger. As a plus, each burger comes with a fries sampler with 4 different types of cuts so you don't have to order fries on the side. Don't expect much from the fries though, just average.   We shared the Mac n Cheese burger and asked them to cut it in half for us since I knew it was going to be monstrous. We also got the rojo rings (HUGE onion rings) and it came with this surprisingly great sriracha/ketchup dipping sauce. We even used it for the fries that came with the burger. It was messy to eat but so tasty, and I'm not even a fan of mac n cheese. Btw I think the menu said it won some sort of nyc burger competition in 2013 so there you go!  P.S. there's no cooling system if you choose to sit outside so keep that in mind for the summer time

7tH9IUVTqnkQZ3rkmikRkw.text: I wanted to try this restaurant out with my wife. It is over rated I had the 68 Cajun chicken and it was very salty and I have high blood pressure. I thought it would have been better than this for the price I paid. Very expensive

NUGADOUDd-tU6BZN5iufLA.text: I had the six cheese Mac and bacon burger and it was delicious.  The fries were a nice touch as well.  The service was quick despite the number of people and the waitress was courteous and helpful.  The ambiance is unique and we were able to eat on the patio which is pretty much right on the strip.  I will definitely go back

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6idiavO-PrqzStYqiircpA.text: For all of the exuberance and hype, I had expectations of some good, flavorful food.  It was a letdown.    We started with wings and brisket nachos.  The wings were ok, certainly not great.  The nachos had the most flavorless jalapenos and the brisket tasted like cold cuts.  For my entree, I had the poutine.  The gravy and cheese were melted in a pool at the bottom of the bowl.  One congealed mass.  The fries were nice and crisp and they stayed crisp.  The "steak" was, I kid you not, 6 bites of the toughest meat I ever had.  The flat iron was not properly trimmed, and was totally streaked with connective tissue.  It was impossible to cut.  I had ordered a side Caesar salad.  It was billed as being garlicky.  The salad came out when I was almost done with my entree.  It tasted like Sysco dressing, no flavor.  The croutons which were so tantalizingly described on the menu, were nothing more than torn pieces of stale bread.  One saving grace of this place is that they had good beer from Victory Brewing Company (Golden Monkey) and IPA from Pizza Port.

WWGCF5ZDWYjn2j-KRp43Ag.text: We went to this restaurant because the wait was reasonable for a Sunday morning. We sat on the patio in some excellent weather. I cannot comment on parking because we walked over from the Bellagio where we were staying.  They have the coolest bacon bloody mary here. The portion sizes are pretty good too.   Service was very good as well. Plenty of coffee and water, which worked for us because we were out late at a nightclub the night before.

mxnGbULz28ZWer_B8jf5mA.text: There are so many burger joints to choose from don't miss this one!  Mac and cheese bacon burger  is a must! Big enough to share which is what we dud. Great variety of fries in order not extra.   We ate at the bar and enjoyed a beer and best burger. Fun atmosphere and by all the action

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac and cheese bacon burger

rjLHdwRJBi55XGFqbzXG2Q.text: I've been here twice and both times service is good and the food never disappoints. I've had the chili beans bowl and another time had a chicken Caesar salad. My boyfriend had a burger the first time and a chicken sandwich the second time. All the food was great. The fries are go die for.

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burger and fries and chili bowl. Both very delicious.

nutGvIX5HarY3AjiT0rAEQ.text: I decided to try one of my favorite Food Network chefs restaurants out while visiting Vegas. I wanted to give a 2 star review but because it's Guy I'm giving an extra star. The stuffed mushroom shareable lacked flavor. I then ordered a medium well steak that came with garlic mashed potatoes and asparagus. I had to send the steak back as it was more of a medium rare, unfortunately it came back tough and still flavorless. I expected to pay a little more because of his name but I also expected the food to be worth it.

KaVxEQg9XFQJRIM_qW9kog.text: Had the mac and cheese burger and awesome fondue dippers.  Loved the fondue dippers and more mac and cheese on the burger please.  Super server Alex!!!

SRnuPP1SlOfjVnVR43OaVw.text: I'm sorry, I had to give this place 1 star to write a comment. If I had the choice it would get none. I had the worst experience at this place.  The hostess was great, the waiter was inattentive, brief and not friendly. I've dine in many of guys places but this place is not the level you expect from a Guy restaurant.  2 people salad, wings and burger. $70+ Carls Jr had em beat.

MITrRIg_wL9WURXg0VeAEw.text: Flavor Town!! And the Sheriff of Flavor Town DDDeLivered!!!! The food was amazing and the staff was awesome! Helpful, knowledgable about the food and history of the company and restaurant. Our waiter, the Sheriff of Flavor Town offered some of the best service we have had in Vegas. The manager came by our table 3 times to check on everything. Love Guy Fieri and Love this spot!! Two Thumbs up People!!

b53QjvnNANhAO8jEF616rQ.text: Great food and great service! I normally don't eat meat and I'm always a little disappointed when the only things on the menu that don't have meat are the fries and salad. I ordered the Caesar salads and was not disappointed. Dressing was a little strong on the anchovy, but when pair with the croutons it was amazing. The croutons are some sort of Parmesan and Rosemary... Awesome! My boyfriend ordered the classic burger, I believe. I tried a bite and meat was the perfect ratio of fat to beef, the bun was extremely soft and fluffy, but held up well. He commented multiple time about how it was the best burger he'd ever had. He is a food snob with a few things and burgers are one of them. Guy certainly picked an amazing menu! Service was great as well.

c7W7rtU77iOGj4zBlHE0Xw.text: Great place to try. Awesome atmosphere and great food. I had the pulled pork sandwich which was delicious. Also tried the ribs. If you like smoky ribs you'll love these

NJyVpEIkoXBsB1TVOR1Atg.text: Good place for burgers. I've had the ringer and the bacon mac n cheese burger (way too rich for me). The servers are friendly and food comes out relatively quick. I've been here a few times and have always had at least a 30 minute wait. Def worth a try!

eHkRV1cqhD4fYegDzou5yw.text: Went to Guy Fieri Las Vegas Kitchen for an early dinner and loved it! This is Smash Burger but bigger and better!  I ordered the Fireball Whisky Wings - I agree with the other reviewers here, not my favorite, but it was a beautiful app.  I ordered the Original Ringer Burger for my entree and loved it! It was well seasoned and delicious!  I love the mix of fries that come with the burger.  It's genius.  I will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dig in! The Original burger!!

gh1cHsGfVgIojbTc69YTuw.text: The food here was great but the service was beyond lack luster . After waiting 30mins for our table and seeing that the restaurant was maybe only  70% seated, i was already irritated that we were put on a False wait or the hosts just didn't realize what's going on in the restaurant.  We then sat and waited another 15 mins to even be greeted by a server who was actually flagged down for us by another table nearby that noticed we had been waiting a while.. the server seemed nice but unapologetic about our wait and even stated that he wasn't the server for our section but he would take our order .. he took our order and the food came out quickly but incorrectly. A new server took over our table after the food was dropped and she was very nice but not attentive enough. we then waited another 20mins just to flag her down for the check as she zoomed by checking  every table but ours. I never once saw a manager check the section in the entire 2 hours that I dined even though I feel they should have made an appearance after we were left waiting so long to be greeted

CxkuvZW3zMglmlt45M0csA.text: My gf and I eat here the other day, and I have to say it was amazing good and everything was amazing big and great quality of food. Great service from our server NICK. I believe locos should try this place, it's a must go!

Z5lMoRicyh0MBeqq0t6Zpg.text: May 27, 2015  21:45  Location is good and patio view is nice.  Our service was very poor.  15 minutes before drink order was taken.   Another 10 before food was ordered.  After the server delivered the food, that was it for service.   The waiter never showed up again.  We had to go to the waiter station for service.  No second beverage offered.  The food was tasty however very over priced for what was served.  The Mac and cheese burger tasted well but was dried out.  The fries are over seasoned.  It is like eating the crumbs from the bottom of a bag of bbq chips. Chicken wings were good except that the larger ones were raw and bleeding in the center.  Ketchup would have helped the fries and burger go down but apparently there is a shortage here. You get approximately one package served in a small container.  No opportunity to get more because Raymond was too busy elsewhere (visiting with other staff).  The wings went uneaten and were removed from the bill. No apology or resolution.   Our biggest impression was how unwelcome we felt and that the waiters would prefer no that customers were present.

mqAWefNlcx9eUdHQTGM75Q.text: I enjoyed the trash can nachos with brisket.  It was piled high with meat and cheese and the service was excellent!

avTjPGNm7ef2fG_FRqixaQ.text: Delicious wings but felt cheated. Half of the wings was chopped off for the sake of representation

FLZDf_kjQl8Fq78lxnYGpQ.text: We had the triple T fries, bacon mac n cheese burger, tatooed turkey burger. Food was amazing! Nick our server was wonderful. Definitely come back and recommend to others.

TWMJWzGjJOROXQb-Qf2z6A.text: I was very excited to try this restaurant especially since me and my five year old watch the show all the time. So let me give my honest review.. Pros: Great Atmosphere , great staff and nice presentation of food. I loved the great music coming from the promenade, that was tons of fun!! While waiting.on my food I mingled with other guest checking out their food which looked good, this alone got me excited Cons: Quality was lacking I ordered truffle fries which was very greasy to the point it looked under cooked ( just bad) my husband got a burger and for $18 I expected more burger it was a really thin patty, our waiter told us they were all the same size. ( we wanted the biggest one) we brought our son and of course there was no kids menu or anything priced cheap enough to buy for a child. I also thought the menu was just lacking of different options. I actually left feeling sad and disappointed b/c I begged my husband to take me here all week and this just did not make the grade. What a disappointment!! However since im local I will give it another try in a few months maybe they will work some of the kinks out. Im a believer of giving second chances

--G7s40Vgbh-VrhL3seOhQ.text: I am from Texas and I can't avoid comparing the food quality in Texas with here. I absolutely do not recommend this restaurant. The service is good but the food quality is low. I ordered the bacon mac and cheese burger which is one the most popular foods here according to Yelp and I was very unhappy with the quality. Very dry burger and even the fries on the side was not fresh. Big dislike, NO STAR

S_RwOU9Bh1h98PU2w7_MVg.text: Decor is fantastic. Location is great for type of food. Casual. Unfortunately we tried it two mornings on our Vegas trip and the service is the slowest of any bar or restaurant we visited this weekend. No other place cam close. 45 minutes the first morning. 15 minutes the second morning. Just sitting at the ledge overlooking walker-by people. Second morning after 15 I headed into bat to order bloody Mary's. They are excellent just not worth the wait. The location is excellent just not sure worth the wait. Did witness bartender making the drink - not sure I would make the bartender put all accompaniments together each Bloody Mary. Seems to add 1 to 2 minutes instead of they were ready would take about 10 seconds. Not a big difference if making 3 or 4. This place is making dozens. Tried breakfast plate. Was ok. Price for everything isn't too high.

2JZ19h3lcy6fJkpWVGbzKQ.text: Amazing food! I had the bacon and mac burger...sounds like it'd be overwhelming but the flavors were amazing! I only ate half but finished the other half later and it still was amazing. I highly recommend!

qASB3MiT1K7D3kFPZggwPw.text: I had a food credit from my hotel and thought I'd give it a try. I would absolutely return! I just got the BBQ wings and chili fries and was totally blown away. Our server had a ton of knowledge and was super helpful. I made sure to take my leftovers with me this time. This place is on point!

Tkra1FT-pfzhjhwWS3Oeaw.text: If you can get past the tired & snotty hostesses, you're in for some great food! Came for breakfast and had the burrito.....Excellent! Came with a side of freshly baked tortilla chips with salsa and guacamole.

VQQXuYpwW0S801oCxXLpJQ.text: Great food! You can really tell this is guy's restaurant his touch is everywhere I just wish there was a little more space between tables,  feels like you're eating with strangers but other than that the food and service was great!

4MLeygU4-TAk5ER1tUNb1A.text: We came here mainly just to say that we did, during a recent weekend getaway. We stopped in on a Thursday night after a trip to the High Roller. There were 4 of us (2 couples) and we all started with a  variety of drinks...I opted for the "Lemon Drop - Not" and it was very good. We shared the Vegas Fries and the General's Wings. Both very good. We ordered 2 of the Bacon Mac-N-Cheese burgers to share between the 4 of us, again just because we felt that we "had" to order this dish if we were at Guy's restaurant. We weren't expecting much to be honest. We were all so pleasantly surprised that this was the best burger ever! It was fabulous and I want to go back to Vegas just for this burger, and this is not something that I would normally have picked from a menu!   Then the highlight of our night when we jokingly asked our server when Guy would be joining us. He pointed and said he's right there if you want to ask him. Sure enough, Guy was in town and we had the opportunity to meet him. He even took some selfies with us...yes, he took the selfies. It was a fun way to spend our first night in Vegas.

zedFHzKwpAz4v61KUS4KVg.text: I wanted to grab a quick bite after my drive in from LA.  I was craving a burger and boy did Guy not disappoint. I've been to Johnny Garlic's in San Jose and I loved his burger there. For a Friday night the wait wasn't too bad about 45 minutes. But we got lucky and some spots on the bar opened up so sat down. Ordered some beers (great beer selections by the way) and Los Nachos del Jefe which were on point. Then on to the main event, The Off-Da-Hook Original Smash-Burger.  The name fits it perfectly it is definitely off the hook, the brioche bun is a great complement to Guy's Bourbon sauce. Bring your appetite as this thing is not only tasty but big.  The fries were also excellent but the main attraction is the burger.  If you  are looking for a burger in Vegas that will fill you up and make you happy this is the one!

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Off-Da-Hook Original Smash-Burger

MHnULnvP4PEOxWdKMpHRSQ.text: Fun atmosphere....Problem came when we ordered 2 beers...It was a little after 3p on a Friday, busy but I can't imagine their busiest...We figured it took 30 minutes to get our beers....Our server came by 3 times to apologize, apparently the bar bit---maids don't accept help and work at whatever pace they're able....I couldn't figure out where the breakdown was occurring,  considering the manager apologized to the table next to us...Anyway, the beer finally arrived and the food came out about the same time....Food was good for high end bar food....my husband's pulled pork sandwich was luke warm, he figured it was because the pretzel roll was frozen when they made it up...I got the burger w/ pastrami....Expect to pay almost $20 for a burger....I would have rated it probably a half star higher had the beers come out in a timely manner...

c3N9NJeVH4i1DbDW3iu4Tw.text: Big let down!!. Got the pulled pork sandwich and was dry pork which was coated in season. Ate half and all you could taste was seasoning. Wife had a chicken sandwich and same thing all seasoning flavor doused in hot sauce. To many tables crowded together. Service was lousy, didn't even check on our drinks, basically brought stuff out and left. Wasn't even crowded on a Thursday at 3:30. Big fail.

i1BgSqKjU10rzD9Hz5SQLQ.text: Guy, great restaurant atmosphere, flavorful sensation coma, yepper. Fantastic service via Nicholette Portions were minimized, small to have a five inch hoagie on a $16 blackened chikn, local let down

l1qmfHSazcGxsEu1qd0cRA.text: Being from Santa Rosa we had to try his new spot. Holy Moly...the Chicken Fried Bacon on the biscuit was not to be missed. I would go back to Vegas just to have that for breakfast again. We were on our last legs after a long weekend but those bloody mary's looked off the chain....we will be back for sure...much luck Guy!

CY3Nz5dEBCuJdwcYP9FITQ.text: A wonderful environment. Very "Guy" from the shows I've enjoued watching him on. My husband ordered the mac and cheese burger and absolutely died over it. It was big and full of flavor. I personally didn't find it as enjoyable but if you are a mac and cheese lover you may love it too. I had the pastrami burger and it was full of different ingredients that made it unique, tasty and full of flavor. Id rate the burgers a 4 out of 5 for sure! The fries were a mixture of crinkle and thin, they were overpowered with seasoning and cold/stale. While we were waiting to be seated, we saw a man putting fries on a load of plates before the burgers were done-I really think we got one of those that were sitting out for 20 minutes or so. We just didnt eat the fries. The prices were a tad overpriced, we had to wait 15 minutes for a seat with multiple tables open and cleaned and the fries were just a big disappointment. Overall this was a good restaurant, burgers were good but old stale fries removed a star.

E3VAVrN9zCo5ekBR-JMOng.text: Ok is all, save your time and money and go somewhere else.  Service was mediocre.  Food was good but greasy.

IFHENui2wBJ-dzDDwD9mKg.text: Over all I liked the place.i ordered the beef sandwich with the dipping sauce. I got to say it wasn't the best ,in fact it tasted funny.ibwas only able to take three small bites.i brought this to the attention of the server.he sent the manager ,and said he would take care of it with a discount. I paid 9.50 for three bites of a sandwich ,I know that I won't be back.

H0heyLewm8moAbMxVOCxjw.text: Went to go try out the new breakfast menu here and wasn't very satisfied  sadly. We had a few issues with the food as well as the service. What I can say is Melanie the manager there was AMAZING she took care of us!!! They just opened up for breakfast which we did know but Im sure there lunch and dinner menu is a lot better. I will go back to try out the rest of the menu because of Melanie thats for sure!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LCqU_q2ZuOalHKqq_hap3g.text: I had heard vey mixed reviews of this place before we tried it ourself.  We love Vegas and trying new places but we also like to return to places we love.  We just returned for the second time to this particular spot, I told my husband we had to go.  BESTTTTTT BLOODY MARY you will ever have.  I plan to go back every time to Vegas just for that.  We sat at the bar and our server was fantastic, she actually helped us the first time we were there before we sat down at our table.  Service was wonderful, she suggested some of the bigger drinks to split to save some money! That was a hit with us since we were a group of 8 girls there for a long bachelorette weekend.  The turkey picnic sandwich is awesome!! I got it both times.  My husband got a sandwich with chicken and sausage, he loved it.  Their fries are very unique and taste like BBQ chips!! Love it! Will be going back for sure time and time again.

uw-whFDp9az_T7UBHGL5Tg.text: Vegas has much more to offer don't waste your time here. We decided to give it a try this past weekend and it was a huge let down. Waited forever to be seated- there were plenty of tables they just had not been cleaned. My boyfriend got the motley que it was so cold and it tasted like lloyds bbq you would buy at Walmart. I got the Mac and cheese burger, mine was also cold and lacking in flavor. The drink menu isn't even impressive. We both took a bite or two of our food then tabbed out. They have cool looking fries but once you get passed the shape they really aren't anything special.  If you want a good sandwich look elsewhere!!

tiHFDYnkIFodnPP0uZeTQA.text: I swear this place has angels in the kitchen. Amazing food and great service. Food had tons of flavor, and the extra ass cheek gained was well worth it.

K3irvCtlKPE-c7S1SZ7VLQ.text: Back for lunch and it was awesome!  Loved the wings and the bacon Mac and cheese Burger!  Beer flights were awesome!  Thanks to Nick the Sheriff of Flavor Town for all his awesome recommendations and great service!

eOyZQMcB1xvwQ8hrY23o1g.text: It was coming up to midnight, most restaurants had closed up for the night when we came across the guy fieri burger place. The hostesses looked tired but were friendly, the food was interesting and nicely presented. Burgers and fries really good, my only criticism was I found the meal a bit salty but overall was very happy to have found a decent meal that late without being gouged because it is on the strip.

UshdOVjVz6NX1g279FeaiQ.text: All the food is great. I've never hard a bad meal at any of his restaurants. The service was wonderful. I had the chicken tacos & the wife had the pulled...pork sandwich. Both were delicious! We also had dessert which was fantastic.

DtHYT1iwdxLLYws1Hd-kaw.text: Let me start off by saying I am a fan of Guys and was ever so excited to visit this restaurant while in Vegas.  I had the Mac & Cheese Burger, husband had the Motley Cue which both were phenomenal.  My problem here was the service and spacing.  There were 4 people in our party and we were sat at a table that would normally seat 2!  This food is largely plated and fries came on a separate plate, add to it my husband is 6' 4" you can imagine the dilemma.  The service was extremely slow on all fronts, presentation of food, drink refills even down to asking for and receiving the check.  Food is great but be prepared to wait.

z8P2TGi-OOq9sSlFw9N7XA.text: Service started out good but dwindled quickly! My Bloody Mary stood empty for more than 30 minutes and so did my water. The blonde bartender did circles around us. NEVER asked us if we needed another drink or anything! We will not ever go back here! Such a disappoint too because we got engaged at Guy's restaurant in Santa Rosa, California.

KirwGoYRDnRdv2MPwFkm6Q.text: Pretty disappointing.  Dry fish tacos - also pricey, no side.  Burgers, french dip and chili were pretty good but also nothing too special despite the price.  Service was good, but came with several very heavy handed hard sells at the end of the meal for shots.  Solid "meh".

H8L1ZIPBJA6SdjA0Tk3dTQ.text: the mac and cheese burger is exactly what it is: all of your evil food pleasures piled on top of each other and of course it's delicious. Other than that, nothing too extraordinary. Has a fun denim western look, lots of TVs for sports. The server was great, friendly, excited and helpful. The group of girls standing around the entrance as hostesses looked bored  and were unfriendly.

S_XUSFU1lm2ptcSXo7WC3A.text: SO SAD! We went last night at 6:45. It was busy, but we managed to snag 2 seats at the bar.  The customer service was great, courteous at the door, friendly and efficient at the counter. We are taking the time to write this review and giving only 2 stars because of our disappointment with the food quality (again) AND the sticky/messy/dirty condition of the bar seating area.    We live here in Vegas and have been going to this location since we moved to the area in 2015.  This is our 10th time total, first time in the last 9 months. We noticed a decline in overall food quality the last 2 times we were there - lacking in usual flavors and noticable lower ingredient quality.  Figured it was a bad day (morning), the first time, so we tried again. When it happened again at lunch time...well, that's why it took 9 months to give it one more try. SO BUMMED!  Guy's Kitchen & Bar was one of the places we used to take visitors to :(  The meat quality/flavor was not there (hamburger & steak sandwich); the fries were old, possibly fried a second time to heat up & both our breads were a bit stale. Again the usual flavors and freshness were not there. Not up to the expectations given the celeb name and prices. Thank goodness the bar staff were great.   As for the cleanliness issue, the bar top was clean (busboy also great), but the bar rails & floor were a sticky/grimmy mess. Not a "someone spilled a few beers AND syrup TODAY"  sticky, but rather a "not properly cleaned or cleaned with dirty rags LAST COUPLE DAYS"  sticky.  My husband was in restaurant mgmt biz for +25 years, so he could tell. SO BUMMED!

2DfC3VkaBl1BhxJ5EOZoQA.text: Saturday, August 5, 2017 - 1:00PM Lunch Seating: Table (Inside) Party: 2 Adults  This was somewhat my first time to Guy Fieri's Kitchen. Let me explain. Went on a Carnival Cruise back in March and the cruise had a Guy's Burger Join, and it was AMAZING. So when I came to Vegas (with the same friend I went on the cruise with), my party and I thought we needed to, without a doubt, check this place out. SUCH A LET DOWN!  CUSTOMER SERVICE = 1 Stars The wait to get a table was a little lengthy (20-30 minutes) but we considered that normal since it was the middle of the lunch rush on a Saturday. Now when we got seated, our waiter was really nice, but there were so many mix ups with our order. To say the least, the entire ordeal was a disaster, and our waiter was practically absent the entire time. Both my friend and I had to flag him down to get any help.  FOOD = 1 Stars An absolute let down. First, between the time of us ordering and actually getting our food, it was about 45 minutes. I can understand a place being busy, but that's ridiculous. Next, the drinks. My friend had ordered a soda, and I got a cocktail from the bar. The soda came at a normal speed, however, my cocktail didn't arrive until after my food did. This was with having to ask my waiter twice about my drink. And sadly, the taste of the drink didn't make up for the service on getting it.  Moving on to the food. I had ordered one of Guy's famous Original Ringer Burger (a twist on a BBQ Burger). Now you can get either fries or a salad. I usually order my entree with fries, and then get the salad on the side (as an appetizer kind of deal). When the food arrived, the only thing on the plate was the burger and a salad. Additionally, not even all of the fixings came with my burger (I had to ask for them). When I asked my waiter about the fries, he said he would get them. I was charged extra for the fries (which are several more dollar charge than the salad).  In the end, for two people, we paid over $75 before the tip. Not happy.  ATMOSPHERE = 3 Stars The atmosphere was pretty nice and was Air Conditioned, something that was extremely needed for the middle of summer in Las Vegas. The decorations and theme were pretty great, and kept my table somewhat entertained as we waited for our food.  CONCLUSION: Really Disappointed. Went into Guy's really hoping to have an awesome experience, but with how much we paid, versus what we got, made the deciding factor for my friend and I; we won't be coming back on our next visit to Las Vegas.

3Xr1aLSa3E6-olcJHfpPMw.text: This is a must try when in Vegas. There's a lot of eateries out there but this joint stands above others. But let me tell you bring your appetite! Food items are huge! We had the nachos, which is served in a can and the server delivering it, removes the tin can and the nachos squirt out, . The bloody Mary's are also a must, and you can have them accompanied with a selection of of foof items as garnishes. There is a long wait time for a table, unless you get lucky and find a seat at the bar, and you avoid the wait time. Also the waffle fries are bomb!!! The kitchen is an open concept, and you can see the creative genius working as they prepare and cook your food. This is a fun place, from food to their service to all other offerings.

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bring your appetite when dining here, massive portions. Great food!
Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nachos are a must when dining here. No need for further discussion, nachos definitely the way to go

3nwXrA2B12ad5Yl4fARynQ.text: Stopped in for a couple orders of the wings. The Fireball Whisky with the wasabi-blue cheese were fantastic. The General's wings too were also crazy creative with the different textures to dip each wing into and add extra flavor variety.  Our only regret is my wife and I filled up so fast on these wings that we didn't get to try the massively gorgeous burgers that servers kept carrying past us. Overall, we would definitely stop in here again next time we're in Vegas!

osE2tHrkmLDNc5uQ4hQRwA.text: The best burger I've had. Came here with the family and was blown away by the 20$ burger I ordered, it was definitely worth every penny. The poppers were a little hot but great flavor and the trash can nachos were just as good. I highly recommend guys spot

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mmegZuWx24RZQfUHw6ToQQ.text: We had a really nice experience here! We ordered just appetizers and the two that we ordered were plentiful for the three of us. We saw "Trashcan Nachos" on Instagram, so we had to stop and get them! They didn't disappoint! We also got chicken wings and fries and they were very tasty. Would recommend for appetizers and drinks!

bhXfRXt_pwYJ5KGR8yEOAA.text: I went here with a group of about 8 people, almost everyone ordered burgers except me, and they all raved about them, even my 8 year old who orders his plain loved it. I ordered the bbq plate which wasn't great, the bbq sauce could be better so I'd say just stick with the burgers! Also my plate came with Mac and cheese which I had high expectations for since I always hear about the famous Mac and Cheese burger here, but it got a thumbs down for me, needed to be creamier and needed more flavor.

R_J1iSHKBRDnEXr2NhOIxw.text: I went here on Saturday March 9,2019 and I thought it was a good restaurant with good burgers if your into greasy food.  The wait was long because it was a small restaurant and it was popular because it was owned by a celebrity food critic. I rate it four stars because the wait was long. The hostess said a 20 to 25 minute wait but we waited for 30 to 35 minuets. Our waiter was a little weird and it took forever for our food to come out. I recommend the Ringer Burger because it has barbecue sauce and onion rings on it. Plus the donkey sauce is really good on burgers. But the fries were hot but a little to crispy. Thanks to Guy Fieri for this great experience in Las Vegas

fy18mkEHo8AaUEEsd4jEkg.text: Was thinking, I need a Bloody Mary...walking down the strip early on a Saturday morning.   A quick search on the trusty Yelp app led me to Guy Fieri's. The place was super packed, it was maybe close to 10 am and the line was already long. Lucked out and found a seat at the bar. The Bloody is about what you'd expect from someone as gaudy as Guy (out of bounds, bro!). It's big and overflowing with garnishes.  Runs $15 but it ain't lacking in booze or flavor.  Not to mention they bring you out a small plate because you're basically getting a personal appetizer as well, what with all those garnishes.  Can't speak to the trash can nachos (although they looked interesting) but if you're in the mood for some breakfast booze, this place is as good as any.

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bloody Mary comes with a personal appetizer resting on top.

4zbC58xWGISeSqJSRTGz0A.text: Food was good but I recommend not coming here on a Saturday night. The wait to sit was really long and then we waited 45 minutes for our food. Plus the food was a little sloppily made. Waiter did okay considering how busy he was.

DiJTqL4RH99zLJfWWBe6wA.text: We shared the Bacon Mac N Cheese Burger. The burger was ok if not a little oily and the frys were "dusted" in a nice BBQ seasoning. Service was good. Prices were a bit high.

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon Mac and Cheese Burger

vcdTbxA52Xy32bEFfT2WCg.text: A little or commercial for me. The food is good but I was expecting a little more exciting menu considering all the places he can draw from but a cool tourist destination to experience.

qUl7PxWMVcl96htn5hQ4Qg.text: This review is all about the Trash Can Nachos. I thought it was a corny Fieri gimmick but they're legit. Delicious. The best I've had.  The secret is the cheese wiz and burnt ends.    It's an upscale sports bar with a solid menu.  Service was good.  If you like upscale bar food, this is a good option.

Rrxgk1LgaTL7hq-6u5Sl6Q.text: The service was decent, but the food was so-so. There are SO many food options in Vegas that it's hard to pick. I didn't feel like this was the best I could've found, but I wanted to visit Flavortown. The brisket nachos were interesting to say the least. Not too sure that BBQ sauce and nachos clashed too well together, but it wasn't horrible. I would say it's a place to try if you're as obsessed with Guy Fieri as I am, but only for memeing purposes.

lI9A2HMkRCuvwEChB-gJkw.text: Guilty pleasure of mine is watching diners drive in and dives. So I know I had to go to one of his restaurant next time I was in Vegas! Got here at 3ish (Saturday) and found two empty seats at the bar (if available skip the tables and go straight to the bar). We were treated with a smile and of great news happy hour! Even better $5 shot of patron! We ordered the bacon mac and cheese burger, Montly-que sandwich, and fiery wings.   First the burger - meh.. my girl likes it. But to me the appeal of mac and cheese must've passed me cause it just tasted like an average hamburger. Meat to bun ratio is great tho! But sadly the meat was dry.   Second the montly-que was A-freaking-mazing. Nuff said!   As for the wings! Very good, a little to the salty side. The blue-cheese wasabi dressing was very good. And FYI, if your not using blue-cheese on your wings, your doing it wrong!!   Over all happy with the experience and will be back!   Oh pro-tip! During happy hour, burger comes with a beer!
