2QiaYHBWi8ibvLj1YjN9ow.text: Food absolutely sucked fries are over seasoned burger looks great but when you take a bite it taste worse then any fast food place. Sad how they get traffic because he is on tv. Do yourself a favor and never come here

g_WbUKVGEXWIsO3BzJ-A5A.text: There nothing special about this place beside a celebrity owning it. The food is mediocre and is wayyyy over prices for standard food. We got the...   Breakfast burger- (2 out of 5 stars) It is so huge and stacked with all sort of stuff that you cannot take a bite without everything falling apart. When we tried to bite into it.. either the bacon or egg would fall apart. Typical burger, nothing special.   Tuna poke won-taco (1 out of 5 stars) Tuna was not fresh. I could smell it as I was chewing... tuna was mixed with mango but I could still take the bad fish.  Lobster lollipop- (2 out of 5 stars) 5 pieces of tiny lobsters covered with batter on a stick but at least the dip  that came with it was good.  Fries- (2 out of 5 stars) it was a variety of Waffle, crinkle cut fries etc.  but it was way too over fried that all I could taste was the crispiness like chips. Not my type of style when it comes to fries but some will like it.

5UFZdh7fyzXN-5VQQwYSKw.text: The food is terrible.  The place is dirty from the forks to the food tray you're expected to eat off of.  Guessing Kristia must have been s-faced (her words) to like it.

x0S3Qqb_mVm9vHQwXINKRA.text: So this is our 3rd time here and probably our last. Our trash can nachos belong in the trash. If they would of loaded the toppings on there like I see on the other photos on here, then it has to be good. But it wasn't and we were so disappointed that it was a small portion for $20... meaning what they gave us didn't look anything like the trash can nachos we see on yelp.  The worst thing I  ever ate was the NY strip. I ordered medium rare and they gave me medium well. Fattiest NY strip I've ever had. It also tasted burnt. All I tasted was burnt meat. Even the potatoes tasted like they were "stale?" Not crunchy, not soft... it tasted like an over cooked microwaved baked potato... and it had the same flavor as the steak.. burnt!!! None of the toppings made it any better.. it was disappointing and disgusting.

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. If you like the taste of burnt meat and stale potatoes. This is it

ERJni6MuUeIH4gFD8re3dg.text: I was staying at the Linq, and received a $35 food credit.    I went through the credit in practically one meal, but had two alcoholic drinks with that one meal.  I went three times over the course of four days  My first visit, I had something called the Tatted Up Turkey burger and it was huge but i manged to scarf the entire thing down and the pretzel bun it comes on was exactly the type of bun this sandwich called for. My mouth is watering just thinking of it.   My drink of choice was the Cucumelon. Watermelon and cucumber.  Yes, the two go together very well with Hendrick gin, so I went for a second one.  My second visit I had the Flat Iron Steak with smashed potatoes, it was basically brunch for me, around 11am so I went with one of the Bloody Mary's they sell.    Im not a bloody mary drinker at all, but this day it seemed like everyone sitting at the bar had one, and I didn't want to be the odd man out.  I was NOT disappointed. I cant tell you all the stuff they garnish the bloody mary with, but I drunk on it for maybe an hour after returning to my room and didn't eat the sausage that was part of the drink until sometime later that night.   its Vegas baby, they let you leave the restaurant with your drink   The third day I kept it simple with the Fireball Whiskey wings.  Not a fan of Fireball, but these wings were delicious and the blue cheese, please someone get guy to bottle that up and sell it at my local Publix  Get plenty of napkins and plenty of water.   Returned to the cucumelon drink.  Again, I went for a second one.   I'd happily return, even without the food and beverage credit.  This place deserves all the wonderful hype it receives.  Outdoor patio, bar seating, tables, TV  Sits between the Linq and Harrahs

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The perfect summer drink  Cucumelon
Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. tatted up turkey burger, my phone clarity is horrible and this sandwich was heaven sent
Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Even if you dont build your own, they do a good job also

b7LgIG2I5tFtRxvKZuuWxg.text: We ordered three different meals and all were very good. Mac n cheese burger, BBQ sandwich and French Dip sandwich. The fries were good but a little spicy. Nice outdoor seating. Friendly staff. Wait time was pretty accurate.

YoV42SFshtJQedTChwkapg.text: The food was good but the menu is small. They do not do substitions for cheeses buns etc. and really push alcohol. I understand this is Vegas and all but every 5 minutes "anything from the bar yet?". Really felt like you're just settling to get something because they menu is so small and particular. Desert menu is amazing but can really enjoy something better for how much we spent

u5KoHL-uU4jlsYlDM5WA4w.text: Wowza! What a delicious and unique burger! My friend and I split the huge dish, and we were happily filled (not over stuffed). Bacon was great. Fries amazing. Fresh, fresh, fresh tasting meat and bun. Ambiance a little too noisy for my taste, but hey, it's a Vegas burger joint. It has that vibe you would expect from Guy's place. Tables and benches could've been a little cleaner (hence the one star deduction). I bet the onion rings here are the bomb. The s'mores looked ridiculously great!

87-M3dj35YxOMa64PQn8bA.text: Food is generally excellent but service has been consistently slow. I have noticed the chili bowl is 75% cornbread and 25% chili which wasn't the case a year ago when we came. Also they brought down the quality of the fondue dipper sticks.

abmzpceby4c3we9GEBJWVA.text: I ordered fireball wings they were good nice flavor my family had the sandwiches they really enjoyed them fries were good and also the pretzel sticks

agtBO9kbcsXKgPRaFqVMaA.text: Don't eat here. Stupid overpriced for super ok food. We got an appetizer that was pretzels with a cheese dip- it was fucking rold gold pretzels with Velveeta for $15. The Mac and cheese burger was fine, not at all cooked to order and not at all worth twenty bucks. All other strip restaurants are a better choice.

mrhB5hlZebCZpeiuP-VpyA.text: Just went to this place with my wife. Not that busy at all, we sat right away. It took the waitress 15 minutes  to come to our table and we ordered waters. Sat for for another 10 minutes, not any sign of water, and the waitress didn't even come back to get the order, and we just left

AjJ3cQwt49TfsnQ-OF9iOA.text: We love Triple D and Guy Fieri, so wanted to try his place while in Vegas.  We loved the atmosphere of the place and the menu looked really good. I had the Greek Salad and my husband had the wings.  They were both very tasty.   The wings were"trimmed into "lollipop" shapes, to make them easier to eat", in doing so they took  the one part of the chicken, with the least amount of meat, and cut off half of the meat to make the "lollipop" shape.  I don't know who thought that would be a good idea, but stop it!!  Wings are messy, give me a wet nap, don't cut the meat off the wings.  Maybe they thought by taking off half of the meat, you had less to eat, thus less time to get messy??  Not sure, but for those prices, I want ALL of the meat left on my wings. I'll deal with being messy.   The Greek salad was very good, but the lettuce was not cut up, at all, and by the time I finished cutting it, and was ready to eat, my husband had eaten all but one of his wing "lollipops".  Thankfully I looked up in time to stop him from eating the last one and was able to try them.

lSI69BsiO0lmylhQlYEZGg.text: I am really bummed, my kids and I love Guy he is fun and we are ridiculously hooked to DDD.  However, today we visited this restaurant and it was a major thumbs down, food tasted commercialized, no different than a TGIFridays.   Like if you were at Guy's house and he made it would be bomb but for restaurant food we gave it a D, service was a D- needs less to say we won't be going back. Waiters seemed forced, food took 40 minutes to arrive and our server didn't bother to check in us in between.  The Vegas fries were cold and soggy and the waiter said it's because there was a change of shift, hence the wait. well that would have been nice to know while we waited not after we got our food.  There are better burgers out there folks. Sorry Guy, still love ya

1EnTD7GyEFcADmtlziaS9Q.text: Thank you Guy for a great birthday for my son. His grandmother came to Las Vegas. Everybody in our party wanted to go to Guys at the Linq. Fabulous meal! The only place my son wants to go for his birthday parties now

6PuvVP188LrpqcmVbXJeQw.text: Very excited to try this place and was pretty disappointed. We waited 40 minutes for three plates of breakfast and each came out cold. If we wait that long for food it should come out hot from the kitchen, not cold from sitting in the window.

eKf9xUjzDKcVAEPgYGbXbA.text: My wife and I were here Wednesday  for dinner.  Place was very busy so sat and ate at the bar.   First things first- service was excellent..  We were asked repeatedly if we needed anything. Cudos to the staff.  We hade the Vegas fries to start- I loved them, wife thought they were a tad too spicy.  We split a Mac-N-Cheese burger, which was outstanding flavor.  Mrs though it could have used more "mac-n-cheese" and I think she might be right.  It was a decent size so spitting wasn't bad- especially after the mound of fries.  I had 2 millers. Tap was out so they gave me two 32onz cans (with a cold glass) instead- no extra charge.  Mrs had two lemon drops drinks.  Bill was $60 which I thought was a bit on the cheap side- given the location and name on the restaurant.  I'd remind this spot.  We liked it more the Gordon's pub.  Recommended.

E4nb_MLlPWLZ8tNd1H_8dA.text: The Vegas fries were amazing! The burgers are just jaw dropping awesome. I will definitely be coming back. I will hands down try all the burgers here!!! Definitely a place to go.

h5lGruV01Hhif9tg21E-uw.text: Staying at the Flamingo we decided to go next door to the Linq to try this Guy restaurant as we have tried his Mexican restaurant in Laughlin a couple of times. I gotta say that based on the pulled pork sandwich I had I wouldn't go back. I have definitely had better for less money. Pulled pork is definitely something that people can be picky about and I hate it when I get big chunks of fat and tough char. The pretzel bun was good but I ended up tearing the sandwich apart to pick out tye good meat and take off tye terrible sweet pickles. The menu says it comes with pickles but I assumed they would be dill and they most definitely were not. The fries were good as you get a mix of about 4 different types but the presentation doesn't make it very easy to eat and avoid most of them falling to the floor. Definitely disappointed but glas we tried it to find out. Service was good and the patio seating was nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pulled pork sandwich

bGCqWFnAX67f0Vn2Itlijw.text: Great service but the food was just ok ..pretty much it was edible but no flavor at all.the food is very overpriced and it's sad because after paying all of that money on a burger I would expect every bite to taste like some kind of wonderful in my mouth .i could have cooked a better burger at home to be honest with you.i would have like more table space at the table too .it's pretty cramped in there and u could only order one entree per person .don't have a date and order and appetizer because  you would have to connect another table just to get situated .for me to be a fan of guy .GUY YOU NEED BETTER COOKS  so disappointed I wouldn't waste my money again

-ovgJ8I2AOXQ0v0sad1K4w.text: My husband and I typically try to avoid places that look touristy. Even when we're tourists. I don't like Hard Rock Cafe and other tourist traps like that. The food and service are usually terrible and they usually have terrible beer selections and watered down cocktails. When our group chose this restaurant we were skeptical but starving so we took a chance. We all LOVED it!!! All the food we ordered was amazing. Great drinks! The service was awesome! The server brought me the wrong dish and when I pointed it out she was very apologetic and the meal I originally ordered was at our table within a few minutes. The manager came out and apologized. They left the food I didn't order at the table so our group could eat it. The manager gave me a free beer. The way it was handled was very impressive! This place was very good and everyone in our group was pretty amazed by our awesome experience.

5cjmqXZ5h9GID62DPFOuIg.text: The Sheriff of Flavor Town aka Nick was an amazing waiter! The Panoe Cattle's (all six of them punch bowl style) were so refreshing! Best drink in the entire world! Wings and nachos were off the hook!

MeHxAbm6IoLcR1pR2_lgUA.text: Well I had the ringer burger and it put me through the ringer. I threw it all up right after leaving the place. Enough said...

ta-k8dMUxyKMl5E06-7Alw.text: This place is stupid dummy fuckin retarded fire! I ain't never had something this good before. I'm gonna dream of this meal tomorrow

w0LDzkOziG2FsYKx8QnyMg.text: This is my first time posting to Yelp despite using it on my constant travels, but this experience warranted it. Whatever you do, do NOT get the brisket here. If you've ever had brisket anywhere else you'll be sorely disappointed. If Guy himself ever walked in and tried the brisket they're serving, he'd rip his name off the sign and burn the building to the ground. Everything else I saw looked delicious, just avoid the brisket. Save your $34!!!

cFnD7rRSjSlVen1ck0Y41A.text: Yummmm. yummm and double yumm mmhmmm.  We were out on the town in Vegas and we decided to give Fieri's place a try. Already anticipating the dining choices, I contemplated wearing a full body bib in an attempt stay presentable throughout the rest of the night. Well at least I tried.  In anticipation for the bold and delectable flavors on the horizon, I had keep myself composed and hold back the taste buds from over reacting, leading to a mouth-gasm .   We sat at the bar... Because it looked super cool. The bartenders were helpful and entertaining.  We ordered up some grub. And when I say grub I mean some good quality and generously portioned quality dishes. I can't emphasize how good it was.  For the record, I'm a fan of the Jalapeno Popper and Fieri's are the best I've ever had.  After a great evening of deliciousness, we were off to make it an amazing Vegas night. #DoubleWink  Mr. Fieri, your Vegas spot exceeded my expectations!

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gonna get this started!

pxtcrSRClYirFzvQWukFCA.text: Love getting the lettuce wraps, but I've had warm perfectly cooked food on 4/5 times.  1 time eggrolls were cold/frozen. And burger was a little overcooked 1/3 times. They need Sauvignon Blanc on the menu.  Will return

nIOTUKJBPkypW0x90rOs6Q.text: When in Vegas and there is a mass choice of stars restaurants. Had to go to one of my personal favorites Guy's and well he did not disappoint.   With so many choices I went with one of the most simple meals bbq wings. OMG the sheer simplicity of them were amazing. I loved the sauce. I'm a huge sauce guy and I wanted more I almost wanted to drink the sauce I wanted to order a glass of sauce.   I wanted to order more food and more everything but was trying to keep my meal to $20. So that ended that. But I do realize that everything is more expensive in Vegas. I returned that night to get what turned out to be the best nachos of my life. The brisket nachos I fell in love. The best food experience ever.   Thank you Guy for finding your call in life an chief. The hungry Hawaiian will return.

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bbq wings

SQ0UgJPYDu2mo6QCFPz1og.text: This place is just over the top on everything they make and do but then again it's Las Vegas!  Plenty of seating to people watch on The Strip for a quick bite or cocktails as I did. There are a lot of shareable small plates which allows you to try many items.

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Make your own Bloody Mary&#39;s. I added a PBR beer back!

_TlN-JDshm37m2Zu5EJsiw.text: Had the burgers many times on the carnival cruise line ships so i was expecting a certain standard. came here to the Vegas location and was highly impressed. Loved all the food that i ordered huge portion for the price. Tasted way better than what i was expecting. Fast, clean service will return if in the area

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The ringer
Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tsvMfT1LMfLVQw2HIQkIgA.text: Delicious! This is a must stop place for us when we visit Vegas. The food is always delicious and good portion sizes. The Caesar salad was absolutely delicious - the best dressing that I have ever had! Yummy! My husband said his tacos were great too. Give this place a try and you won't be disappointed.

lZa6Zhf4pPD2BKFe_QhaGA.text: Ok to be fair I only had a beer here, but the bar area was pretty solid and the BT's were quite friendly and efficient! The beer prices are pretty much average for the Strip, and the beer was cold and poured well! I didn't have any food because I couldn't get a loan from my bank to do so, but what I saw other people eating looked good. The food prices are in my opinion ridiculous which is why I didn't eat there, but I would definitely stop in for a beer again! Overall the ambiance is typical GF, and the place is actually a bit small inside, but there is a good sized patio outside! Overall for a beer not a bad choice, food may be good, but it's just way too overpriced!

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Beer!
Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The paddle!

CqE8USIpGM3loLIK8Emqxw.text: This is one of my top 3 favorite burgers. I normally order the bacon Mac and cheese burger when I'm visiting, but this time I went for prime time burger. Just as pleased! They cook the burger perfectly medium-well, so it is juicy and tasty. The fries need improvement, sometimes taste a bit stale from being cooked too early. Either way the burger is reason enough to visit IMO.   My buddy tried the ribs. Wowie. They are tender and flavorful. I was very surprised bc I didn't expect much from them as I'm a Texas bbq fanatic.   Also - I normally order the trash can nachos. They are heaven on earth.

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime time burger

Meyo5lhEqJIX3rMyERsjdw.text: We tried the famous Mac and Cheese Burger and the verdict is that it is overrated, jmo. It is a hamburger with some Mac and Cheese and a slice of bacon with a big size bun. It was good but it didn't have a wow factor for me. The Trash Nachos were much better. It is a gooey mess of meat and cheese and other stuff. I would definitely try it once. The best part of lunch was the desert. The Whiskey Chocolate Cake is really tasty. You can taste the whiskey in every bite. The whiskey, the chocolate sauce, and the cake make a delicious desert. The place was good, but service was slow. Anyway, enjoy Las Vegas and life goes on.

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Trash Nachos.
Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Whisky Chocolate Cake.
Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Trash Nachos.

66v8I3DU4rzM5gbVGcs4rQ.text: Was walking from Harrah's into the Linq and decided to stop here for a bite to eat around noon.  No line, got seated right away outside patio.  It was a nice day outside, but may choose to sit inside next time.  Las Vegas Blvd right next to it and all the people walking the strip.  And so you know the smells coming off the strip may ruin your appetite lol.  Marijuana scent wafted over a few times and a bad sewer smell was really nasty for like a minute or two.  Ordered the bacon mac n cheese burger and Caesar salad.  The burger was perfectly done.  Juicy and a little pink in the middle.  Never had mac n cheese in a burger but it was awesome!!  The Caesar salad dressing had good flavor, but the salad was drowning in dressing.   Ask for the dressing on the side.  $15.50 for a Caesar salad seems like much since there was no chicken in it.

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac n cheese Burger and Caesar salad

S7sJGD1YShof9LaFxWZuUg.text: Our go to place for a quick meal. We started with chicken wings, its ok I thought  it was under seasoned. Had tacos for lunch which was decent.   Not a bad spot for people watching. I wish their food could be better. But other than that the whole experience was good.

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The view from the outdoor seating
Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burger
Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pgQ1MWbz_ZKllDLpKh6yKQ.text: The pulled pork is amazing. The fries are a little different, they taste like bbq chips, but are good. The poppers are good, but it's popper roulette. Made it to the 4 before it kicked back. Great spot to eat on the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The pulled pork is amazing.
Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pulled pork

SMiOiChSs8jGyGVTLIrZ4g.text: I'm staying at The LINQ so visiting here was convenient. We were seated right away and the server came within a decent amount of time. Our order took a decent amount a time but not anything unbearable. Boyfriend ordered the double barrel bbq wings and a side of fries. I got the Cajun chicken Alfredo. Wing presentation was nice. Tasted pretty good but not better than other wings at The LINQ and for $16 they should come with a side. The pasta was okay. Chicken wasn't very seasoned and overall I didn't taste much "Cajun". The pasta was really comparable to something from Applebee's and definitely not worth the price.  Service didn't enhance the experience at all. Honestly, there wasn't anything special about this place. They do offer bowls of cocktails so that's always appealing to me but I didn't partake. Overall the experience was meh.

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cajun chicken Alfredo

6tjZ2SBH836nx3d0BG9CVQ.text: I was excited to try this place but it was just "ok". The restaurant itself was clean, cool decor & a friendly hostess welcomed us. The seating area outside was a little dirty and our waiter, although friendly- was slow. The food is over priced for what you get. My burger tasted ok but was just over room temperature and the lettuce was dry and wilted & my fries were stale! My husband said his shrimp was good. Just a little over cooked. I assume our waiter just let everything sit under a heat lamp too long? So bummer!!! I had high expectations for Guys place

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burger without a bun &amp; fries
Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon wrapped shrimp

SR_FYfkQ7jKy-JkDsPEJBw.text: We had an OK meal here; nothing to write home about.    Came here mid week on a recent Vegas trip.  The hostess was a bit short with us and other customers.  Wait time was 20 minutes, but was closer to 15.  So not bad there.    Once seated, our server came over and took our drink order.  A runner brought one, and the server the other.    My wife went with a salad and shrimp. I went with the Original Ringer Burger.  The salad was good.  The burger was OK.  They didn't ask how I would like it cooked and it came out dry and a bit salty.  I honestly thought I had a better burger at In n Out and Smashburger.  Fries were ok, nothing that stood out.   Service was friendly (aside from the hostess) but felt rushed.  I bet they're trying to turn tables, but this felt like they wanted to get us out ASAP.  I also thought the restaurant wasn't super clean.  Just seemed like the tables could have been wiped better and the floors cleaned of errant food dropping's.    All in all, so-so place to eat.  IMHO, celebrity chef establishments are always a bit of a gamble in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Original Ringer Burger

HC-ppscv1qIkCAHokWmk5A.text: This was the worst experience I've had, I'm handicapped and was put on a corner isle where everyone including waiters hit my walker 16 times. I ordered the Mac and cheese burger medium well and it was more than well done, French fries were hard as a rock and nothing but salty. I could've had a bag of chips . Waitress did nothing about the food to make it right. Then our waitress asks as smoke is pouring into the dining area do you want dessert well you can't have any cause the kitchen caught fire and you should leave. Wow. We asked if she could get us at least a rain check on dessert, she said nope! We decided to just pay the bill and leave but while waiting for her to return she stood by our table for 6 minutes talking to the other waiters then turn to us and tossed our bill with the credit card to our table. I couldn't believe how we were treated. We won't be back!!

N0q0V4_D9Q5ZScVYgVWT4w.text: Gez the tagline for the store outside is "Go big or Home; in your face food" and unfortunately the only thing that was in my was when i was shoving the food in myself. The music was loud but seemed out of date, maybe that was the point im not sure. Me and my wife had the trash can nachos for 20 bucks. I thought it was gonna be a just a overload of nachos and it was just regular. I can compare this to the nachos in Lucilles. Which are half the price and the same amount and just as delicious. Disappointing, if your gonna charge me 20 for nachos at least make it so I cant finish them.   Service was fine, it was just the amount of money you pay for the amount of food you get is not worth coming here. Save your money and get a better deal somewhere else

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cool napkins
Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This...the nachos

em_htN5EWKp2tGhEl4TTQg.text: I had gone on the internet for top ten hamburger restaurants Guy Fieri's was in the ranks. Also when I arrived at the Linq Hotel I asked a bartender for his recommendation. He said Guy Fieri's topped his go to places.  I was thoroughly and absolutely disappointed. The fries taste like freezer bag stale food, tasteless and cold. The hamburger was tasteless and cold. My husband ordered the Mac and Cheese hamburger but with the Mac and cheese on the side. Thank goodness because the Mac and Cheese taste horrible and was also cold. The waitress had to be reminded to bring my glass of wine and my husband said the ice tea was flat. I observed some good looking desserts pass by, but our waitress didn't ask if we wanted to see the dessert menu she just blooped down the $50 bill on our table and mumbled something about Cesar Palace points.

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nasty Mac and Cheese with flat tea
Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stale food

bSBaEu3PYZV6G-d0mKAPXw.text: We went for a later diner (about 10 pm). We were seated outside right away. One of us had the lobster tacos and then other the jack Daniels strip steak. Each of us enjoyed our meals and found them flavourful and satisfying. I would say the "dirty rice" that came with the tacos was a little flat in flavour, but the tacos were tasty and really that's what you are paying for.  The server Monica seemed a little disappointed we only had one drink and no extras.   Overall we we glad we checked this place out. It was convenient in the Linc hotel as we had come from the Jimmy Kimmel comedy club on the promenade.

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jack Daniels steak on potatoes and grilled asparagus
Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobsters tacos

Hjf0N8N4knJrST1b64e4rw.text: We came here in search of Trash Can Nachos and boy did we get them! YUM! Our first round we split 4 ways and quickly realized we needed to either commit to another round or order dinner. Another round of Trash Can Nachos please! We made a group decision to sub in their Baja Chicken, but I'd have happily ordered them exactly as the first round. SO MUCH YUM! and of course we got our obligatory video of it all ;) Two of us were Trash Can Virgins and two were Experts as they had at another G.F. restaurant on the Strip a couple years ago.  They thought the others were better which made me wonder if they were in fact slightly different to make each experience unique...only way to know is to go back and test out both places...SIGN. ME. UP!!!!  I ordered a margarita...the VIP Status...but it was on the heels of the best one of the trip (and likely ever!) the night before so I quickly switched to a Tropical Tornado (hello Blue Curacao!) and regretted not having another before we moved on to our next stop.   I feel like we did the menu a disservice by only having the Trash Can Nachos as the menu was extensive and truly something for all tastes. We were salivating over the aromas and presentation of the food being delivered around us and I do want to explore this fun menu more next time.  Kudos to our server, Matthew H, for asking if we wanted the bill split four ways. He was the ONLY SERVER of any of our meals in our 4 day trip that asked this and we loved him for it!

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Round 1: 3 VIP Status Margaritas and 1 Tropical Tornado!

cCZ_5-dATAHvj9CuAECW8Q.text: Omg such a disappointment!!! My husband is  the biggest Guy Fieri fan so we saved our last day in vegas to go have dinner at his place. We ordered the chicken wings and they never showed up..burgers came in before appetizer even tho we ordered it about 25 minutes apart. Hubby ordered the brisket..it was sooo bad,it was dry and the bbq sauce tasted like it was from the .99 cent store. I ordered the Mac  and cheese burger and it was so freaking dry and bland that I couldn't even finish half of it. Our waitress didn't even care to call a manager or apology about our horrible experience. My husband won't even watch Guy's shows anymore.. I hate being this disappointed about a chef we used to adore :(

MJbucvDUT-PAqnkgfnFyXA.text: The vibe is good and the staff is friendly but the food is mediocre. We ordered the brisket nachos but the meat had no flavor. The jalapenos were freshly sliced and the tomatoes are fresh but you have to pick up each ingredient and place it on a chip in order to build a chip with any flavor. It was an interesting display when serving the food but beyond the initial novelty, the taste is just not there.

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket nachos

ZSRyO7Y8h1F3XpXaLfy4OA.text: This was my favorite burger place in Vegas hands down! The fireball whiskey wings are a must! Trust me you'll love it. You can't go wrong with any burger. The tacos portion were a bit small in my opinion so I would stay away from those... I'm sure they're delicious but they don't come with the fries. Service was great but they didn't get the five stars because getting our food and getting seated took forever. They didn't answer when we tried to make reservations either. But this place is a great spot for a burger!

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drinks!
Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Original smash burger with fries.
Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fireball whiskey wings (I think that&#39;s what they were called) they&#39;re shaped into lollipops lol. So delicious!

8KfAtkPHtYYlyIs7ILmegw.text: Burgers, Tacos, Wings, & Beer.. everything you'd expect from a diners, drive-ins, & dives professional!  The Quad is really starting to shape into an attractive Vegas casino.. as long as you don't see their hotel rooms. haha The addition of Guy Fieri's restaurant, along with Hash House, really steps up the food game in this area of the strip..  Food: Going through the menu, there weren't a lot of fancy-shmancy ingredients or toppings.. just your classic all-American foods assembled into fantastic combinations. I decided to go with the Mac+Cheese Bacon Burger.. the ultimate burger throw-up! The patty: very thin but wide, coming out of the burger covering the entire bottom bun.. while the bacon and mac&cheese slightly oozed out on top of the patty. This is the True definition of a "beautiful mess". Very tasty burger, loved the 5-cheese mac&cheese and the simple "backyard BBQ" grilled type of burger.  The fries that came with the burger came in 3 types: ridged, curly, and wedges.. awesome! We also ordered the Triple-T fries which was like truffle overload with gouda. We didn't get to try any of the specialty cocktails.. there were many interesting concoctions that we'll definitely try next time.  Ambiance: I'd describe it as an Ed Hardy-themed restaurant.. even the napkins had skulls. haha. A lively restaurant with high, exciting energy. If you're there for lunch, definitely sit outside.. you get the view of the walkway between Harrah's and The Quad, and the front of Caesars. I'm not sure how it is at night but probably crazy loud with Harrahs' Carnival court right next door.  Service: Staff was great.. there were two consistent servers continually checking on us. It was a bit of a wait for our food to come out but I give them a little leeway since the restaurant's still brand new.  Tips: Don't pass up this place if you're torn on what to eat on the strip. Grab a burger, a few drinks, and enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. outdoor seating scenery
Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Triple T Fries(truffle, truffle, truffle)
Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon Mac&amp;Cheese Burger!

CyRgqOez55Bv60KutZaAEw.text: He gets knocked but the food was great!.  Great service, tv's.  Its right on the strip, we had a great time. I am in Vegas often, I will come back.

hJxJ8P-lyTnVIO1ANQlMhA.text: Would have probably been given 5 stars if it weren't for the flies and the non cleaning of my plate. Im pretty sure we've all watched chopped and know that part of presentation is cleaning off the excess juices and etc from the plate before sending it to the table. Well my plate looks like the allowed my steak to rest on the plate and then added the sides and sent it out.  Other than that the food was great. The flavors were good. Oh and the fried ice cream is a must have. It's definitely a sharable item. So save room.
