Not my first trip here (30+ visits over the last 16 years).  But $12 bucks for what looks and tastes like Hormel chili out of the can with grocery store mix cornbread on top?    I thought GF would know real chili does not have beans.  He doesn't.  The cornbread fell apart immedaitely and was placed on top of the chili which prevents the scallions and sour cream that were on top of the cornbread from getting into the chili.  Such a simple dish done so horribly wrong.  Did I mention it was $12?  The sandwiches ($20) I saw served to those seated around me looked like something out of a dive (and not a good one).  The presentation said $7 not $20.  Do yourself a favor and skip this place.

uMRZIkYdushm_ARba2KAvw.text: I knew going in that this place was all flash and hype. It was confirmed immediately when my food arrived. It was all a mush of the same flavor from appetizer to entree. Very boring, no flavor. They did make a decent white russian. Meh.

gGwMZvQ-3tv5Gip77jlqKg.text: Worst expensive nachos I've had in my life! Guy needs to take his name off this place!

cH_J1japWC9fprQg4hRBvA.text: I was not sure whether to give this a 3 or 4 star rating, but finally settled on a 4. The food we had was good, the atmosphere was edgy and what we would expect. We loved the chili! It was hot with corn bread and cheese. The service was something to be desired. It was cold and we were sat outside next to a gas heater. We were warm for a time, but the heater started to run out of gas and our waiter could not do anything. Our second course took forever and we were so cold that we asked for our food to go. The waitstaff was very slow to respond to our request to pay or for support.

6IfZGvqze8bTAuH8rUPyqA.text: I was reluctant to go here cause I live in Northern CA where Guy is from and he has several restaurants here I can go to. But we decided to try this place for breakfast before heading back home.. the food was actually very good and the portions were crazy... loved the watermelon shot of juice that came with it.. Bloody Marys were delicious.. BUT my biggest complaint would be they do not have Latte's I guess they have a Espresso Machine.. HELLOO even McDonalds has Latte's... so I am sure you can get a machine that is easy for your employees to use... so for that you only get 3 stars...

LOapQ9Sz1HxRWJtlNP9agQ.text: Had lunch with the family here for the first time and was better than expected! We all ordered a different dish and were all pleased with the presentation and quality of the food. Prices are reasonable for the quality and relaxing atmosphere. We will definitely return again. The Staff was really cool and made sure you were well taken care of.

0rvG4j_kX7L9aBre9p8QEg.text: Came here after seeing some promos for it just opening. Pretty cool vibe to it, with a mix of music from the outside carnival court and music inside. A little loud for my liking but I get it. Really friendly staff all around. I had the mac and cheese burger and it was really good. Huge portions of everything!! Wife had the the asian wraps and the pepperoni sticks. The asian wraps came out cold. I will try it again down the road. Overall a decent place for some good food.

Jle15gyFORpdLz14Nf10VA.text: Honestly the best burger I've ever had. Mac and cheese burger. Comes with four different types of fries. Ask for a side of ranch for the fries. Creamy and garlicky. YUM! A must go when in vegas. Aside from the food the atmosphere was great and the staff was very friendly. Oh and love the skull napkins. Had to buy a pair to take home.

d7I_D0yvtKXoIptEa1oKdA.text: Let me start of by saying the service we received was excellent... Sadly that's where the nice words stop. Our cocktails where average at best, the cocktails waiters could use some additional training. Now on to the food... This would have to be some off the worst food I have eaten let alone at such a price. I order the Mac and Cheese burger and found it so dry that I was only able to eat half. My fiance had the ribs and found that they where 90% fat and incredibly chewy. Watching her try to eat them made me wonder if I was engaged to a hyena. We also order chilli cheese fries, these where probably the only decent dish. My suggestion if you really want to visit this place is head in buy a drink enjoy the service and maybe have some snack food, don't waste your time with a full meal.

DTjwwJOP65hDch7qMoxUvw.text: Great. Just a few issues. Drinks are ridiculously weak, and he pretzel stick app wrapped in pepperoni with with a queso sausage dipping side was just too overwhelming a salty. Otherwise I fun menu. Mint chocolate chip ice cream cake was amazing.

9ttTovrqeY0ZrpMHqFt4Bw.text: The Mac&Chesse Burger. It looks great, but unfortunately the meat it's self had NO SEASONING. Maybe it's just because I'm Cajun, but you can't have a good Burger without good seasoning.  My Girl got the trash bucket nachos. They wasn't anything to brag about. This place is overrated in my opinion.

Eryn91b8WCsh2JPbAlFTHQ.text: All I can say is wow! This was the best food I've ever tasted! I ordered the Brisket trash can nachos, and the bacon Mac and cheese burger. They both were bursting with flavor! I could instantly taste how fresh and delicious every single ingredient was. I even give their ranch dressing 5/5! The atmosphere was awesome! I had so much fun in the restaurant I literally left with a huge smile on my face! I also bought two bottles of Guy's brown sugar BBQ sauce that was on the brisket, I can't wait to blow my friends away when I cook ribs with it later this week! Thanks for an awesome experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Awesome atmosphere and presentation

hTx06jetHKEBR8PN6CHPsg.text: Service was terrible. Won't be back.  One example: Got steak and eggs, told the server we wanted the steak med well and it came med rare. The server and staff were not friendly at all. It used to have a great atmosphere, not any more. No wonder the ratings are low.

3hccRpPvujf7m6kt40axHA.text: Must order the nachos just so u can watch the show. The food was great. Would highly recommend the frozen shots. My bacon mac and cheese burger was top notch.

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon mac and cheese burger

vEQzaIKrAx1vAp0Sjzm6dg.text: Disclaimer: I'm a Guy Fieri fan so my review will be a little biased. If u love triple D you're going to love this place!  From the first moment you walk in it screams Guy Fieri style. It's very rugged and a cowboy feel. The staff wears jeans and cowhide vest or aprons. Very cute!  Lots of little details. You can tell that a lot of thought went into the decor. I definetly appreciated it. For Guy fans, his UNLV coat is hanging by the kitchen entrance. I love the open kitchen concept! No fishy business behind doors!   We ordered the rojo onion rings. It comes on this nifty metal pipe. The oil dripping from it was mildly disturbing but you're not coming here to stay on your diet! They use nice thick cuts of onions you can really taste and the breading was pretty crunchy. The only downside is that the breading looks better than it tasted. It was very bland. We couldn't appreciate the sweet or spicy aspect..the breading was just crunchy.   The truffle fries were AMAZING though! The gouda on top and the dipping sauce were soooo good. We inhaled that thing! Definitely a must!!   We also ordered the mac and cheese bacon burger.  It comes with a side of seasoned fries cut into 3 different shapes. They were pretty darn good! We fought over the waffle shaped ones. The burger itself was a thin flavorless patty and the mac and cheese wasn't very cheesy. Very unfortunate.   Do try to save room for dessert! The S'more monte cristo is so amazingly good! When it comes out the marshmallow is melted and oozing out saying "Eat me! Eat me!" Very nice presentation..in fact everyone around us was asking about it and someone came over to take a picture. Now, this dish tasted as good as it looks! The brioche was nice and crispy on the outside and soft and chewy on the inside. Kind of like a funnel cake. I couldn't really taste the graham cracker but I didn't care because the chocolate and melted marshmallow was so good! It comes with a delicious raspberry sauce on the side and a dark chocolate sauce. I mostly used the dark chocolate sauce. As a chocoholic...u can NEVER have too much chocolate!   So I gave this a 4 star because the decor is nice, great service, short wait time for your food. That earned it 3 stars. For the 4th star...it really depends on what you get here. The burger and onion rings were bland but the truffle fries and the monte cristo was very very good. (Flavor town good!) So I gave it another star for those two items. I think its worth coming back to explore the rest of the menu but I would come back for those two things and be happy also!

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle fries and onion rings
Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. S&#39;more monte cristo!

bR_nbGKR4ee3co2cN-WOXg.text: The food that we ordered was okay. We got the BBQ beef brisket nachos, and the BBQ Cracker barrel wings.  The cheesecake is huge and enough to feed three to four people to share it. I prolly won't be back unless one of my friends that can cook like I do, saids something is really good here. Until then, I don't feel as tho I'm missing anything

The Mac and cheese that was there looked dry and not appealing at all.... The presentation looked great but other than that my tastebuds were not satisfied!! ND63pWw1cgQ7gNonLvZxfA.text: My favorite place we ate in Vegas!  The decor was exactly what you would expect from Guy, and it looks awesome!  The prices are good, for Vegas.   The food was amazing. I had the Motley Que, and it was hands down the best pulled pork I have ever eaten... And I would expect it from Guy, a man who goes crazy over them when they are presented.   We also got the fireball wings, and while delicious, and very nice to look at, we did wish they weren't lollipopped! We want the meat!! With everything else being messy, don't lollipop for easy eating... Trust me, we will dig in!   My boyfriend got the macaroni and cheese burger and loved it! Juice was rolling down his arms. We both had to do "the hunch" to eat!  The staff was very helpful and pleasant, without being over bearing!  Amazing place, definitely go check it out.

q640hLzQFBHtgLUr7DiLeA.text: Had a great meal here tonight. The burgers are amazing, service is fast and atmosphere is great. Prices a bit high, but the quality is worth it.

wWTSTUB-8S4wjc1Wwhdezg.text: It's Vegas! that's the attitude everyone on the strip has when something happens and there's no other explanation for it however, when it comes to food and a name like Guy Fieri, you'd better come up with something better. We went there to cap off our day on the strip and hopefully finish off on a good note. The restaurant sits in a pretty busy corner of the linq so expect constant traffic, noise and the occasional drunk A-hole who passes by your table and belts out some crude remark. The restaurant decor is very cool, we opted to sit outside but after a few minutes we knew we should have enjoyed the interior, especially on a hot day but we thought we should just tough it out after all, it's Vegas! We were initially seated right next to the railing but since it was windy, we asked to be seated further inward which sparked a look from our hostess as if we had killed her kitten. After sitting we waited about 10 minutes before our waiter realized we were sitting there (even though he passed by us several times) he promptly took our drink order and since we had been waiting a while we decided to give him our dinner order as well. The drinks arrived about 10 minutes later, the beer was cold and yummy, if you have multiple people in your party who drink the same thing I recommend the pitcher instead of individual drinks, it might save you a few bucks. about 20 minutes later our food arrived, the presentation was good but the portions were disappointing for the price. Now mind you,  it's Vegas! so be prepared to pay Vegas prices for anything you order especially at a place bearing a food network star's name. The burgers were OK but definitely not worth the hefty $20 price tag, you can find hearty, tasty burgers somewhere else on the strip for a cheaper price. The Greek salad was definitely disappointing, it was four large pieces of romaine lettuce with a small serving of mixed vegetables and some feta cheese in the middle, definitely didn't warrant the $20 price tag either. Then came the wings, you get 8 drumettes for $16, yes, that's $2 a wing drumette but hey, it's Vegas! We had both varieties, the hot wings and BBQ wings, both sauces were tasty but about halfway thru our wings we both got a couple of wings that were raw in the middle, we set those aside and ate the others. When our waiter stopped by again, we told him about it, he said "I'll tell the manager" took our plates, and offered to have the kitchen cook us a couple more, we declined, we didn't want to take a chance at this point. We lost sight of our waiter again until he came back and offered dessert, we looked at each other and wondered how his conversation with his manager went. We declined dessert and asked for our check. The check came, of course there was no adjustments for the uncooked wings but we thought the manager would stop in and apologize, of course he never did so we paid our bill and left. Now one thing to understand about my reviews, I don't expect any compensation when an establishment comes up short but I expect them to try, if they try I will give them full credit for it and consider that in my review. It appears Guy Fieri's Vegas restaurant is riding on his reputation, hinging on the possibility his name will excuse any sins his staff and management may commit but there's a long way to go for his name to fix all that. It's disappointing to see Guy Fieri's restaurant is just another pedestrian eatery on the strip that comes up short in all phases of operation, I would rest assured that if Guy was sitting at our table and witnessed our experience, there would be some vacancies at this location. There are hundreds of choices on the strip, make one of those other places your primary choice and avoid Guy Fieri's, your belly and wallet will thank you for it. And remember, after all, it's Vegas!

twhY8E0m4zlwnu9eHsxA7Q.text: Just had tried the new breakfast menu at Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen. I had the Dragon's Breath Chile Benedict - a generous portion of chili over house made cornbread rounds topped with cheese sauce and poached eggs. The sweet of the cornbread counters and compliments the savory chili, eggs and sauce nicely. As a side note, take your Zantac! My wife had the Carne Chiliquilles very flavorful but had to search for the beef.   Small ding to the score due tithe lack of beef, and some unhulled  garlic  in the chili.     Don't get me wrong, Guy has some great flavor profiles in his food much to his credit, And I look forward to returning to Las Vegas to give his Diner another try.

ylRxjs9DkdTB3FdBf2xjAQ.text: Food is not worth the price. Mediocracy is the name of the game for the service. Keep on walking... id rather have the $6 mcnuggets at mcd's

bHJFsFYduvplCILIovN-Aw.text: The food here is yummy! We had the Cedar plank salmon and it was so moist and delicious! Everything coming out of the kitchen looked deadly!!! Will def come back next time we're here!

ustChhpXF9CmCrTpOhoG3A.text: This place was... just ok. Really nothing that testify's to the massive line that can accumulate other than the name on the restaurant. Maybe our expectations were too high?   My Hubs got told that the bacon mac n cheese burger was going to be the best burger he ever had so he was REALLY pumped because my Hubs REALLY likes burgers! Not, the best burger he has ever had. He said it was middle of the road. My burger? I got the simplest one on the menu and the beef patty itself was no more than 1/4 inch thick and it hung way over the bun. I may get shot for this, but my burger tasted exactly like a Harvey's hamburger (for those of you in Canada). I like a Harvey's burger, but I also only pay $5.00 for it.  The service was good although our server was a bit socially awkward. It made us laugh and he was truly sincere :-)

1uTRAl6TDgn-fMqnUq7oag.text: I waited for 1 long week to eat at Guys Vegas Kitchen on my birthday Nov 12th just to be disappointed with the Mac n Cheese burger.  What's going on with you Guy? Have you even tasted your own burgers that you sell and created?  It's like you grabbed the ground beef from the pack and smashed it up with no seasoning. One of the most flavorless bland burgers I have ever tried for over $20.  It's sad when I went to Jack in the Box the next day and the Ultimate Cheese Burger was better than a majority of Guys flavorless Burgers. FYI: If you eat here don't order a burger.  You will waist your money and feel the same way as you do when you lose at the casinos.   On a good note, the Ribs where amazing with that smokey flavor. Also the nachos are really good.   I will still watch Guys show but will never return to his restaurant.

CbsfJ6SS-LvmSqa3udIE7w.text: This food was over priced garbage... the brisket was like pot roast, the slaw was dry as a bone and the garlic bread had no garlic or butter... stringy and fatty. The chimmichurri was an oily mess with no spiciness or herbs just a pool of oil on my plate. The smashed potatoes had no flavor and way too many fried onions. The side Caesar salad  was a joke the o my good thing we ate was the asparagus!  Never again!!! There's a 1000 options in Vegas go somewhere else!!

n4NF6Wo7hUeZG9P4Qxft0Q.text: The food is ok. It's on par with TGI Fridays or something like that. I ordered the veggie burger. My wife ordered the barbecue sandwich. The barbecue sandwich is by no means worth $20. The service was not good. The server didn't seem like she wanted to be there, only asked how my wife's food was, and never asked if we needed anything. Don't waste your time.

-jVQvTktgDq4Fs1fwpQP9Q.text: I love Guy and triple d so I reallllllly wanted to love this place, but unfortunately I was disappointed.  I'm short, my experience was over priced and sub par.  At around 2pm on a Friday, There was quite a wait to sit inside, but immediate seating on the patio. We opted for the latter. The restaurant couldn't control the weather, but some misters out there would be nice.  The waiter took some time to get to us, which was particularly odd since there were only a couple tables seated outside. We ordered water and he had to come by twice to say our drinks were on the way... -_-  We passed on any appetizers as we found that section to be a little lacking. Actually, I expected more from the entire menu.  I ordered the Cajun chicken sandwich and my fiance ordered the signature mac and cheese bacon burger. We both finished our waters and didn't have a refill until after our food arrived.   My Cajun sandwich tasted like the chicken had been pre cooked and then reheated with the vegetables and seasonings separately. The cheese was melted into the roll and then the filling placed on top. When it arrived, the cheese had hardened again-as if it had been waiting under a heat lamp for some time after being cooked. I asked for a side if ranch, and wouldn't you know...I finished half my food before it arrived.  The "signature" burger wasn't all that much better. First, they need to use a different bun. It fell apart immediately. The burger itself was dry, overlooked, and under seasoned. I think they hoped all the other toppings would mask that. Unfortunately, the Mac and cheese was bland. The blue box at home would have left this stuff in the dust. The bacon was carelessly placed and hanging off the side  when it came.  I will say the fries were good. A combination of curly, shoestring, crinkle cut, and waffle fries with some BBQ cheddar kind of seasoning.  It seemed like everything on the menu was $20. We passed on the disappointment of ordering a desert and chalked this experience up to something we could say we've done. :/

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Signature Mac &amp; cheese bacon burger
Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cajun chicken sandwich and fries

uTrc-kwIY8Ro4aMO_4bgNw.text: It hurts my heart to give Guy's restaurant a 3. It just didn't blow my mind as I thought it would.  First off, the menu is extensive and everything that Guy Fieri stands for. The menu even reads like Guy talks. Fries, loaded fries, wings, burgers, brisket, sandwiches, salads, dessert...it's a big menu. They also have breakfast as well. I would like to come back and try breakfast -- we came for lunch.  We started off with the Fireball Whisky Wings - they were an interesting flavor, you can definitely taste the Fireball, but they were a bit dry. The wasabi blue cheese that it comes with is delicious. Overall, not my favorite. I'd like to try the General Tso's next time as our neighbor table got them and enjoyed them a lot. The burgers sound ginormous, but they actually are very manageable, so don't be afraid. I got the Triple B Burger ($19 creole blackening spice, blue cheese, bacon,lettuce, tomato, onion, donkey sauce on a garlic-buttered brioche). Underwhelming in flavor - I wouldn't order it again. My girlfriends both got the Mac & Cheese Burger and they loved it.   The service was the pits. We were drawn in by the "Hangover Recovery- Build Your Own Bloody Mary" sign, as we really needed a recovery. When I asked our waitress if I could see the Bloody Mary menu, she said "pick a vodka and pick a spice level 1-5." We had no idea how much they cost and were disappointed because that didn't seem like "building" to me. I went on the website to look at the food menu to help jog my memory as I write this review, and, there is absolutely a menu for the build your own bloody mary (you choose a protein, you choose garnishes...I'm irritated).   I would go back, because it's Guy Fieri, and the menu is extensive so I would hope for better service and to try something else that I would enjoy more.

Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Triple B Burger and a Bloody Mary
Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon Mac And Cheese Burger.

4WzrMUcpH5CgJs28aNiAig.text: You have just purchased a one way ticket to FLAVORTOWN! Where everything that touches your pallet is OUT OF BOUNDS! You cany go wrong with anything that you order. My personal favorite are the chicken wings (pick your flavor! It doesnt matter!) which should be illegal they are so good! Great atmosphere, always great service! Always a vegas fav!

ILFhCDgj-PdMLWCMK1kdvw.text: Food is great. Portions are great for the price. Service was ok. It would have been nice if our server actually stopped at the the table instead of doing a flyby and asking how we were doing on the way by.

HG27iCoBmG7uzvflq_guOg.text: To be honest, it was late, we were drunk, and it was right outside our hotel. Only reason we went there.  The service was good, even a little overbearing. I ordered chicken wings and had no complaints. Crispy, traditional buffalo sauce (no weird proprietary sauce), crisp veggies. They were really quite delicious. Winner, winner, chicken wings! (Yes, I know that's not how that goes). I don't recall what my wife ordered (see first sentence of this review), but it certainly wasn't great. She was less than thrilled- even a little upset. Oh! I just remembered! She got a veggie burger. The taste was okay, but it was so crumbly it just fell apart all over the plate. The fries were nothing to write home about. As with most restaurants on the strip is was slightly overpriced, which is to be expected. And it's noisy. There is indoor and outdoor seating which is nice. It was just fairly generic food for a chef's restaurant. Sort of like eating at a Cheesecake Factory with a much smaller menu. Probably won't go back.

viUR34LwPSjtYgcThktC0A.text: I have had Guy Fieri's hamburgers on cruise ships and they were always so good.  So when I saw it in the hotel I was excited to get one. I was so disappointed the burger party was super thin and dry and no real choice of burgers.  (Ex. A burger with cheese then you should be able to add mushrooms, pickles, onions and etc.)

0JQlD67znAuiKcwgsm54Rg.text: Hands down TRASH CAN NACHOS best nachos I've ever had smoked pork ,super melty cheese,beans and fresh paper thin sliced jalapenos and ripe tomatoes. Then the burger. Bacon mac n cheese smash burger crispy outside moist inside crispy bacon creamy Mac n cheese the best. Service with a smile can ask for more unless Guy was here to serve us!!!

TofebADKhNBTldM6OLYzvg.text: I wanted to like this place 5+. I really did. I like Guy and his shows. The service and the drinks kept us off a 3 star. Our bartender was the best. Always there but not bothersome. The server who brought our food was funny without being creepy. The place was clean and well done but the food was ... well blah. We had the tuna tacos for appetizer and the onion ring burger. Didn't care for the mango and tuna. The burger was ok. The fries were good. However the Bloody Mary was top notch. The sweet tea vodka was very good. I like the menu has so few items. It lends itself to being really good at a few things which I like. Would try it it again.

PkVCIefX3x3A7bLdPeszVA.text: Went there with my family. The food was good but it was not the most kid friendly restaurant. It also is a little pricey for the burgers. However, we would give it another shot for a girl's weekend trip or something. Customer service was pretty good, especially since it was 11 people in our party.

j6R51PDkXgV1c9exgbNaJg.text: Stopped here for lunch on a Thursday afternoon and it was busy but our party of 2 was sat right away. The menu wasn't very big, classic strip menu, so it didn't take long to pick an item.  I had the Baja Bowl with Shrimp. The bowl was very tasty! Perfect amount of sauce, the sweet corn was tasty, I should have gotten no pickled onions. My friend who I ate with got the Mac n Cheese burger, he seemed to really enjoy it! To me, the Mac n cheese did not look creamy so it stayed on the burger without falling out but that didn't look appetizing. I'd definitely return and try more!

iR3bQui_o6KB1iXcMVKJ8w.text: Out of all my stops on my recent Vegas trip, this is the place I was most excited to review.   I wouldn't say I am the biggest fan of Guy Fieri, but I do enjoy his shows and his recipes. When I saw he had a place in Vegas, I was like "Oh, I definitely have to stop here."   Now if you've come across this place on Yelp, you're probably thinking, "Wow, this place looks good. Kind of pricey, ratings are meh, but it just looks so good. Should I go?" (At least, this is what I was thinking ).   Now to answer your question, yes you should go. This place was AMAZING. Literally, my brother kept staring at me eat (I couldn't put my food down and I just kept eating like a pig. Not ashamed to admit it. It was just that good). I got the Ringer Burger, of course. That is definitely something I recommend. Was the absolute best burger I ever had. My company enjoyed their meals as well. This meal was the only Vegas meal we all finished. It was just that darn good.   Now, I do have some complaints that is stopping me from giving it the full on 5 stars, like the food deserves. The staff here is very bleh. They aren't very friendly and they honestly did not seem to want to do their job at all. I get it, no one really wants to be working, but they were just really slow and not really engaging with the customers.   Would I still recommend this place though? Absolutely. Would love if they hired some new staff though.

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wtNsAxY8p8KcjVURIhGSZA.text: I came here for a Birthday Breakfast / Brunch on a Saturday. The place was not packed at all and we got seated right away. There are only four entree items for breakfast. Of course, everything was overpriced. The portions were pretty big though. There's a good drink menu but it's Vegas...  They had no birthday specials or anything...  We got the burger and a burrito wrap. The food was mediocre at best. I really wanted to like this place and am a big fan of Guy. I was disappointed with my first time trying a Guy place.   Our server was excellent though and tipped pretty well despite the food and pricing.   Location is nice and this could be a place you might want to try once. Maybe their dinner food is better.

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cMB4KHCQ7mgDtwsmAto5hw.text: It was an enjoyable experience. Went in with high expectations because it's a guy Fieri's restaurant. Bacon Mac and cheese burger was good. Drinks were good. Didn't like the trash can nachos ( very soggy). Our waiter was kinda lost,  we couldn't find him and I don't think he could find himself.

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon Mac and cheese burger and trash can nachos.

7NQaG0lo9qQJ66EsB7KNNA.text: I went to this place with an open mind as personally I do not care for the person whose name is on the building. He had opened a Restaurant in Bakersfield which after temper tantrums and arguments with partners got closed.  I remember when he was an unknown star trying out on television. HE had some air time personality but to me his cooking skills just did step up to it. We decided to eat there as we were attending an event next door and didn't want to travel all over town. When making arrangement we advised we had a large party 18. Screech!!!!! As you stomp on the brakes, we were told in order to accommodate that large of a crowd you are only allowed to pick from a pre made menu and have a final dollar guarantee.  Ok fine, sad thing is had we ordered off the menu they would have made much more money, as my guests like their food and we didn't have a budget. We set up out times had to prepay in advance. Following days we arrived. We got to the front where we had to wait 5-10 minutes. Thought this was all set up. Seating no private dining area but off to one side against the windows. It was not the best spot but it was ok. !!0 plus degrees sitting at a window is not always that fun. Maybe the reason for the initial wait was to get food started for us as shortly after seating  Caesar salads and Jalapeno poppers were placed family style at our table. The Caesar was nothing special but everyone seemed to be eating them instead of the poppers. The "pig "poppers in my opinion are a big flop. These guys were hot, most at our table would not eat them. I do enjoy hot spicy food but if they want the average person to enjoy maybe they need be seeded when they are stuffed. They were a nice size but I feel they needed to be cooked more. I think they brought 6 orders to our table and sadly less than one plate was eaten I had two as I can handle the heat, most everyone else passed. One other thing we got on our table was "trashcan nachos. I will say this was a clever way of serving them. There were built up in a tall vessel about 8 inches across and a toot tall. It looks like they build them up keeping it in a nice shape till they come to the table then the wait staff slides up the devise and they lay in a tall heap and fall apart as they are eaten. They were good but they were just nachos. The best thing to them was how they were served.  Our main courses we had 7 items to pick from several burgers an Alfredo, a Baja bowl chicken and a pork sandwich. I took the mac and cheese burger. They claim it's voted best burger in Vegas by Seven magazine, only ad I could find from this magazine was from 2017 and Fierri was not on the list. I ordered the burger less tomato, lettuce, onion and pickle. I wanted to taste this mac and cheese. As I'm dissecting the burger I didn't notice the bacon or onion straws on it. Just a burger with a big lump of man and cheese on it and a bun. The Mac did have a nice creamy consistency to it with a nice cheese flavor. Knock my socks off good no, but good enough. I'm eating this more in a knife and fork fashion to get the flavors in it when I get to the burger patty. I do not know what kind of meat product he uses but if I had to guess I would say its frozen pre made patties. It had that old burger flavor to it. The fries were a sorry excuse for French fries. Not only did they skimp on the portion but they were limp and oily. For desert they brought out 4 "strawberry fools" basically just a strawberry short cake with ice cream and whipped cream. The four large clear glass containers had spoons inside so you just dug out what you wanted. The pound cake had nothing to compare like Mastros Butter cake, whip cream ice cream and berries. What can I say you really can't ruin them?  The one thing I will say is the service was good. But then that's what Fierri was trained to do Hotel & Restaurant management he never was a trained Chef and I hate to say it but in my opinion the food shows it. At the end of the night we dropped several thousand dollars for what I feel was subpar food.  The burgers were no better Red Robin that you can find in every mal in the US.  The service was better than many places but it is like putting lipstick on a pig. It's still a pig. In this area where the restaurant is located there are many much better opportunities for good food and good values. I think one place Id keep walking past.

9qrImmq8VtIBE4n81BUS6Q.text: We heard so much about this place so we came to check it out. The wait wasn't long at all for a Friday afternoon. The staff was really friendly and helpful. I had ordered the Mac and cheese burger which was actually pretty good. The fries had a great seasoning to them and where different style fries which was pretty neat.

s5YaUHQLJkmREu0zfzkLQA.text: Stopped in Guy's for a bloody marry and a cookbook before leaving Vegas. The staff was very friendly. We had already eaten, but the food around us looked delicious. The bloody marry was very appealing to the eye, but I have to say the flavor was not the best. It had a very odd taste. I definitely wouldn't order it again. The margarita was excellent!

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8vLPqFzguWxR7l7XuX3sHQ.text: I expected a little more. The food wasn't horrible, it was actually pretty good at first (maybe I was just really hungry). But I wish I loved it more coming from Guy Fieri. The price point is expected. My boyfriend and I shared two dishes:   Trashcan Nachos ($20): unique concept, definitely shareable and a must try for first timers. Warning: there is LOADS of cheese. I love cheese and I feel that there is too much cheese. The top of the nachos were crunchy and crisp but as we made our way to the bottom the heaping amounts of cheese were just too much and the nacho chips were soggy. I started to get sick of it. The jalapenos and onions are a nice touch though. The meat that is aded on this is also just ok.   Sriracha Wings ($16,50 at 8 pieces): I supposed the wings are not treated with hormones because they are pretty small. The sriracha dry rub was tasty but nothing that stood out to me. It wasn't spicy either. They give you about 2 pieces of celery and 2 slices of carrots along with a side of ranch.   Customer service is ok. Servers weren't bad but they weren't very attentive either.

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Trashcan Nachos
Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sriracha Wings (8pcs)

JvWh2Lrv-0Z04TumoJXhPw.text: Great drinks. Great meal options. Classic entrees and new things to explore. Surprisingly I was able to find a couple of #vegan options. Great location near the LINQ. Would definitely recommend. Not a huge Guy Fieri fan. If I was, this would be a 5.

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pNUjvzwSlxP_JciLhJPj3Q.text: I ordered the trash can nachos for an appetizer and it filled me like crazy. However, service took quite long. The restaurant was packed. Overall, the place is recommendable.

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Trash Can Nachos

P2CyYCS7GYN_UjelG7rlfw.text: Not the worst, but definitely was underwhelming considering the reputation it has. I stopped by because of the name. I would say that they do good business, but it's nothing bad is going to knock your socks off. The wait was about 20 minutes, although they did offer available sitting at the bar, the food was tasty, but the length of time that it took from order to food on the table was probably their greatest downfall.   What does restaurant does well: They have a great location, and lots of foot traffic, so I think their advertisement is strong, they also have a fairly put together a menu that allows you to pick what you want and see everything very clearly, it made me feel like they have a few items but do what they do pretty well.   What this restaurant could work on: there are speed and efficiency, the staff could be much more friendlier, the food was nice but not exceptional, I feel like they could offer a more distinct taste. The presentation is very beautiful though.   I wouldn't go back the price is a bit high for the taste quality.   Also, they do provide rather large portions, so that was nice considering the price.

p4C_acKLI2vNJGIDXJR9Qg.text: This is a pretty fun spot in Vegas and it is located a little off the strip so it is a good way to escape the madness so to speak.  This joint can be poppin at times so be prepared for a short wait if you go during peak hours, but it is a worthwhile wait.  The staff do offer a friendly greeting upon your entrance and take your parties information as they inform you of the wait time, if any.  He interior is fun and seems a good manifestation of Guy's personality.  Not dull by any means and not too flashy as you might expect after seeing Guy's hair.  The tables are of good size and spaced well enough apart that you are not too bombarded by the other Vegas patrons as they hungrily and loudly visit and eat.  The food selection is pretty Southwestern American  and pretty damn tasty.  I have been here 3 times, once with a large group which allowed me to sample a variety of menu items in one sitting and I pretty much liked everything I tried.  My only gripe was the trash can Nachos as they literally come in a miniature can you then get dumped on your plate.  Not bad tasting but what a mess.  I found myself gravitating to the chili the most, looooove me a good chili and the one offered here is pretty good.  This might be one of my favorite spots to eat in Vegas and if I do go back to Vegas I will go back to this place to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

E7Z_3Fus959o538beuoMMQ.text: This had been on my list for awhile so we finally tried it!  SERVICE - The hostess was nonchalant and did not make much eye contact. She did however, seat us very quickly outside with no wait and there were seven of us. Our waiter was friendly.   FOOD Vegas Fries - These were wedges tossed in a dry buffalo rub topped with blue cheese. It came with buffalo sauce on the side and a blue cheese wasabi dressing. I am not a blue cheese fan but the dressing was not terrible. I did not love it but I actually did not hate it either.   Mac n Cheese Burger - The burger was packed with flavor. We did enjoy this as the mac n cheese was not overwhelming. It was the perfect amount of cheesiness for the burger. Because everything was topped, I could not really tell how great the meat patty was.  Fry Trio - This was underwhelming. They were stale and felt like they were sitting out for a very long time.   Overall, I'm always willing to try Food Network chef's restaurants but this was okay. Not bad but not a place I would eat at again

SxbrZq19XpAl3Sa-tgqPog.text: We had such a great time here.  And our classic burger (we shared) was incredible.  And filling.  But seriously, great flavors.    We have been here a few times since it's opened and have always had a great time.  Even on a crowded Sunday for football, was good service and bloody mary's pretty legendary.  Chris the manager even came over to say hello.    We know and have worked with Guy, who really takes these places and experiences personal.  Our experience was really good.  Thanks.    And try the chili.  It's pretty dope too.  As Guy would say.

mmLWVgmlhgQprHMKF-a-gg.text: Super disappointed with his restaurant. We ate at Bobby Flay Mesa Grill last night and it was the best meal we had in Vegas! We were hoping for another great meal from a food network star, but this was not it. Hostess was super friendly, trash can nachos were decent, pulled pork sandwich wasn't for me! I only took 1 bite and didn't want to take another. Spending $22 for sandwich that didn't get eaten sucks! I wouldn't go back. I'd say, head over to Caesars and try out Mesa Grill!

GKGjPqrMvq7AEBPn9ycFhA.text: I love guy and his show and I had high high expectations for his restaurant. I mean he has seen and tasted some of the best places around. This place has great menu options and it's really good just not amazing..it's not that I'm a hard critic just didn't find anything super unique..get me?

FCYxTnuQ-3hsEcXJhuSA-w.text: Awesome Service great Staff ask for Nick! Worth the visit not only for the food but for the hospitality!

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best Host hands down in Las Vegas!!!

ss_tQErs2zWjaHgfT75eKg.text: Great food presentation and drinks! I got the rack of ribs! So good! Patio is a fun setting for people watching.

WG_2GII4pejYdbl2G95itA.text: I love Guy Fieri Food Network show so I had to check the place out. The wait was not as long as we thought it would be and they text you when the table is ready so you don't have to stand around.  I was so impressed with the service. Usually these 'star is born' restaurants are busy and lack service but not Vegas Kitchen. Our server was great, our drinks always full, food came fast, she knew her menu. Most impressed that when the food came out we where not asked who ordered ? The food was good but I think I was expecting some more punch from the meals. Maybe cause I see some incredible stuff on his show. Drunken tacos okay, french fires WOW! The Mac Burger was very good. I live in Vegas and when visitors come, I would take them if they are a Guy Fieri fan.

Cu92z0JxMkGIB8khD-t26Q.text: We went here for breakfast. We came four minutes to eight, and the door was open. No sign of opening hours, so we went in. After ignoring us oddly for a little, we where shooed out rudely, then two minutes past eight (about two minutes later) where let in.  We had the dragon breath chili Benedict and the French toast. The toast was burned, and no matter how rustic that looks, it tastes bad. The egg wash hadn't penetrated, so it was basically just burned bread with bacon that had its flavor killed by way too much sugar. And bananas with caramel. Way way too sweet. There was also a shot glass with watermelon juice and mint. It sounds yummy, but was badly done. Tasted like nothing The eggs where somewhat better. The corn bread was way too sweet (definitely a theme at this place). The chili boring except for a hint of cilantro seed. This would have been ok had it been a five buck meal at a truck stop. Not a 17 dollar investment. All in all, the worst food we've had in Vegas so far. The orange juice and tea where ok

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nicely presented bad eggs Benedict and burned toast

R1ucL0HWK5wALsCpiK3Dig.text: We had the truffle fries, the Victors Street Tacos and the carne Asada tacos.  The fries were really good. The tacos are pretty small, but you get four, so that good.  The Victors tacos were really good, but we didn't care for the carne Asada.   The drinks were watered down but we weren't charged for them so no foul there.  Our waiter was tripping on something. We had a good laugh all night watching this guy. He couldn't stay focused long enough to take or drink order.  Look, we went into this knowing it is a "gimmick" joint that brings you in just because you saw this guy on t.v. and he told you where to get those really good donuts in Texas should you ever be unfortunate enough to find yourself in Texas.  Also, we know that being on The Strip we'd be paying a premium. If this were any other location I'd be ticked at the whole experience.  This place is as average as Applebees and Chili's.

xht0Ggnrr9fauInZ3sC7WQ.text: Disappointed......The food was good but everything was cold when it got to the table. I had higher expectations Mr. Fieri.

uUK6h8gy-m3jjj_F2o5hZg.text: Trash Can Nachos was my target coming here. Couple of groups in my party tried coming here but the wait was always 45 mins. Luckily for us, we went at 5pm and only had to wait 15 mins. The presentation of the nachos was pretty exciting. I mean...it shows up in a can! I thought the bbq on nachos was weird so I opted out on that! I really like the tortillas. They were thick and made to hold a lot of ingredients and I don't think I had a soggy chip. I wish there was a kid menu but I guess, you don't get many kids in Vegas? But I would some here again for the nachos. I shared it with my hubby and we were both full on just the nachos.

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Without the BBQ sauce; jalapeños and poco de gallo on the side.

6jHLVKkDgOY4_3zL3l9OzQ.text: Giving this place 3 stars is quite generous.  The wait time for a table wasn't so bad.  We waited about 15 minutes, which is average. The wait time for getting your food on the other hand is very long.  My family and I are sitting here as I type this waiting for our order to come out and it's been at least 30 minutes.  The average rating for this place is 3.5 and that's really not all that.  The food finally came out...

qFRkYI1HFeGLxFFNClc63A.text: This place is off the Hook! All of the food was excellent. Service was perfect and the beer was cold. Great atmosphere with the music from the Carnival Court. Good price and great portions.

TgD2l9rCPvhs5RKKOo2mRA.text: I have ate here numerous times and loved everything however today the server was beyond miserable and less than helpful he ruined our experience. Then the food came out the nachos came out cold with no BBQ sauce the fire ball whisky wing just tasted of cinnamon! The food was a let down I was so disappointed as I took my family who just arrived from the uk

84JATGG3cwCu-PWr_kQmtg.text: Went for breakfast and got the Chicken Fried Bacon and Biscuits and Gravy.  AWESOME!  Friendly staff!

Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Fried Bacon with Biscuits and Gravy

0s_l0k33PTAqNQ91BPuVTw.text: Guy has a few restaurants and I've heard the one in Times Sq, New York is average (I still have to try for myself) but I can tell you his Vegas location is "the tits." You must try his chili with cornbread and hot sauce, it was unbelievable. We've also tried his mini tacos and signature burger and they were both outstanding. This is our second Vegas trip and second time at Guy Fieri's and we'll be sure to return every time.

35fQWyHDZ5NKvSr_F0aiGw.text: I actually had a pretty good experience here. I sat at the bar and just ordered a burger and a glass of wine. The service was slow and almost to seem that I was a bother rather then a customer. The bartender was more concerned with counting his tips. I ordered the burger rare and was told they would only do them medium well. (not a good start) I ordered it anyway as I just got off a 5 hour flight and was exhausted. The burger was surprising good however even being over cooked for my liking. It all worked and the bun was Delicious as well. It had a lot going on but was still really good. The fries were not to my liking. 3 different types of fries with hot seasoning on them. They were hot, I just didn't like them. In the end I'm giving them 3 stars although I was hovering over 2 due to the bar tender.

0Bx9Fq7shAdLelgofCeLJg.text: I love Guy Fieri, but this place is terrible. Why can't I give it zero stars?  After being seated and waiting and waiting, we had to go ask for our server. She took our order and we didn't see her again until she brought the check. And she didn't ask if all was okay upon seeing that we ate basically nothing we ordered.   The wanton tacos were okayish, but nothing great. The buffalo blue cheese fries weren't good. The fries are too thick and coated.  Fries weren't at all crispy, blue cheese was sparse, and they weren't very warm. The general tso wings were just bad. So DRY!!!  We are very little of our food and ended up going to another restaurant to eat.

8OpeWkc66hrKcpeF50ggHA.text: Service was great.  Waiter promptly check to see how our food was.  Even recommended a beer to pair with my meal.  Veggie burger was out of sight.  Donkey sauce was legit.  Beer was ice cold.  Perfect for August day in Vegas.  Will return.

hddg7UEO99_CzoiUuozjnA.text: Loved the good, and service was great. We had a party of 6 and we waited 45mins...not bad! Everyone had something different but everyone loved there food! Amazing combination of food which made the tastes very unique and delicious! Would recommend for anyone!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

W1YLL2yxvz2ioqKvtxJkzA.text: The food was amazing! Big portions, I had to take most of it home. The service is great, their staff are friendly and inviting.

I6l0fAcMjmrKFNyuLn21gg.text: Burger was delicious. That's what the three stars are for. Service SUCKED! Never received our drinks and when I pointed that out when the check was brought I was given attitude! Will take my business elsewhere next time.

GplmXFVohw7s70mnUhhMDA.text: Wait wasn't too bad on a week day. Obviously a tourist attraction it's conveniently located on the corner and easy to find! We opted for outside seating as it was late and warm outside great place to people watch and there is plenty of that!! Service was quick, attentive and we even felt bad for our server who was dealing with some intoxicated pricks! We ordered some jalapeno poppers, the jalapenos were tough and not cooked for long, pretty sad about that as they looked yummy.  My husband and I both ordered a burger, I wish I can recall which ones we ordered but I honestly can't, but that makes me sad because they were not memorable. We did not feel as if though we needed to return and try more on the menu.  We left pretty unsatisfied but it wasn't entirely terrible, we were just hoping for more.

B9lb6nUrKuWsBaJsxiWjEg.text: For as much as I loved the dirty silverware and lipstick stained glasses, the really cherry on top of our dirty dining experience was a bird pooping on our table, just to look up to see the TVs shit stained. After letting the manager know so it wouldn't further impact future customers as it was unappetizing to see, they informed us bird poop is good luck. Good luck to you and your business because your one bird poop away from a lawsuit.

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bpTnBedOR9Z6QboyLklQSg.text: We stopped in for lunch on two separate occasions during our stay in Vegas. Place gets pretty packed, and the tables are awkwardly close together so be warned you may be literally rubbing elbows and bumping into others trying squeeze around the place. You can choose to sit indoors or outdoors but either option looks Jam packed no matter what time of the day. The overall vibe is cool and casual - very fitting for what you'd expect of a Guy Fieri restaurant. The music they play there is fun and upbeat, seems to be a lot of hip hop especially old school. Service was ok, not top notch, but the wait staff did their jobs and nothing above and beyond.   The food was pretty amazing. There's definitely a ton of flavor packed in everything we tried there, especially in any foods that are spicy. We hugely recommend the lobster tacos (that dirty rice is damn tasty!) and the Kobe burger (fries are a mix of crinkle cut and waffle cut and deliciously flavored). They also have a lot of fun cocktails and fishbowls as well as a decent, but not exhaustive, beer list. It is a bit pricey though and not what we would normally pay for lunch, but it's a good casual place to go to when you don't feel like dressing up and when you want decent portions of food to indulge on.

8vTcf9HbSJhLP23oF-JpMQ.text: I've seen Guy Fieri on TV before so I was pretty excited to try out some of the food. I had high expectations and they were pretty much met.  Since we had no reservations, it took a little while to get seated but it wasn't a long wait at all. We were given a great seat with an amazing view.  I opted to go for one of their signature cocktails that they had on the menu and it was delightful and really refreshing.   The trash can nachos were amazing and so were the fries! It was really delicious. My high expectations were met with great food. My friend ordered the bacon Mac and cheese and he seemed to enjoy it.   I wanted to try some dessert but my stomach just didn't have the room for it. I was so full off of the appetizers and entrees that there was no way I could finish off the dessert. I also had some cocktails too!  The service was pretty good. The servers were really friendly and knowledgeable when it came to the menu. The drinks were refilled almost instantly!

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hWNjUAtBuKoAgYdiCg8j0w.text: Amazing in all respects. The chef was an absolute star. The food came out perfect and my party of 9 was absolutely awestruck by the experience. 10/10 would recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VWgTiIIepUQWhs78wSLMHQ.text: Last weekend was my first trip to Vegas and this was the first stop for some great dining. I watch the show all the time and was really interested in trying some food in person. Oh My God, the food was delicious!!! I will be back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ya0X-RuuoRqjhhcOuCUhVw.text: Not what I expected. I wanted a mouthgasm and it didn't deliver. Mac n Cheese burger, Sarrachi wings, chicken tortilla soup, fries, and the chicken permaroni for dinner then finished with the strawberry fool for dessert. Chicken parmaroni was the only good item that you wanted more. Everything else was just okay for me. I can say I tried but that's about it folks and I dropped $115 without tip. I've enjoyed far better for less money. Not impressed.

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pBAtuNwR2Sgvjgl3IeVgAw.text: We came in this past Sunday for a quick drink and appetizers as we wanted to check this place out. We sat at the bar and had really great service the 3 bartenders behind the bar were all very nice and accommodating, easy to talk to. We ordered the "Trash Can Nachos" not really expecting much they are just Nachos right? No, they were actually bomb! Very pleased! We will be back to have more our next go around to Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ACiMAmHFKqWO0qsHNM_YUw.text: Once again Guy Fieri's didn't disappoint.  I love this place!  I have been here about 6-7 times over the last few years, and I keep finding my feet walking me in the door for more.    My go-to is the Flavor Town Burger.   The name is right on point.    It ooozes flavors and is everything right and good about Vegas food indulgence.   Now, just because that's my go to, don't discount the Turkey Burger or Chicken.   They rock too!     My most recent surprise was passing on the Flavor Town to try the Brisket Nachos and...  oh yeah.   Oh sweet wonderful messy goodness.  I must have been making sounds or faces eating them because the table next to me asked if they were really as good as they seemed.    They were.    I really love it when a place has a menu so densely packed with great food that I am not afraid to explore.   Too often places have 1-2 great items and the rest is just there for the appearance of variety.    Guy Fieri's is crushing it.   Flavor.  Flavor.  Flavor.

NQvGi_3C3ydr8q7ToxK7cQ.text: We had an early dinner here last week, and this restaurant was solid.  Good food, great vibe, good service.  I don't know that I'll go out of my way to return, but it was enjoyable.  My husband and I each got a burger, and it was good.  My daughter got the chicken Caesar salad, which she enjoyed, but wished the lettuce was chopped up a little finer, instead of the huge leaves.  Another in our group got the vegan burrito and seemed happy with it.  Overall, I'd say this place is a better lunch option than for dinner.  They have a covered patio, which would be a great option for people watching.  We ate indoors, and although it was a little loud, it had a fun atmosphere.

BhnOOsmYwenzzYAZOKg0pw.text: The menu is well rounded.  So many items that I'd have loved to try but it was so early and the thought of seared tuna at 10am wasn't appetizing to me. All but one of us ordered breakfast.  I wish the hash browns were more unique.  They tasted and looked like hash brown patties that were diced up.  The rosemary bread had a nice delicate crust but you have to really like rosemary.  The french toast was good and had been dipped in a banana custard which was nice.  My son commented that it tasted like toasted banana bread.  Again, nothing standout and it would've been nice with a better presentation and perhaps some whipped cream.  My lone decenter that doesn't like breakfast ordered the wings which he said were good.  They did look very good.

z1grOOM0I-lXuhfDk6TEjw.text: We thought this place would have really good food, but we were disappointed. The service wasn't the greatest... she was a little bit slow. When the food finally came out, there were only about 7 buffalo wings for one meal, and the veggie burger needed some seasoning. For the price, we expected better, especially with a brand name.

K42MMk6A0h4ydggNOfN3Lg.text: The decor is kinda hard to figure out. I get it Guy is an interesting guy, but it feels all over the place.   We ordered 2 orders of the Lobster pops to share. The pops were good and the lobster was fried perfectly. The different kinds of fries was super confusing.   So let's get to why I have it 3 stars instead of 5. The service, it wasn't what I would expect from a place like this. Our waitress had about 5 tables in our section and I think in the hour-ish we were there I saw her a total of 4 times. She kept disappearing. I saw the bus boy offering to fill my water more than her. The food is decent, but the service just wasn't fulfilling to me.

R8kXTMUylcRWM--Non0f-A.text: This place was NOT a disappointment. I went during restaurant week and order the special for that week. I got the cucumber martini, lobster lollipops and bacon Mac and cheese burger.   The cucumber martini was so refreshing and just the right amount of alcohol.   The lobster lollipops (appetizer) were well made. The batter was light and fluffy. The lobster was cooked to perfection. I liked the sauce that was in the lollipops the best.   The burger was ... amazing. The thick bacon, scoop of Mac and cheese, well cooked burger and special sauce made the burger to die for.   Although there isn't a kids menu (-1 Star) they do offer a side of Mac and cheese or a plain burger (+1).   Glad we made it here and would definitely be back!

Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Lollipops appetizer
Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cucumber Martini

FbztcnGeG5rfGbtR5aW29A.text: Food was awesome! Service was cold.  If you ignore the service, the food is well worth while! Well priced also.

LpLgzhCdtSWQ5IeV9GtbYw.text: Super duper slow service. I ve visited a few times and have been disappointed both times. With all of the burger joints in the area Id expect this one to be a lot better than it is. Its is only meh. Did I mention how SLOW this place is... even when not very busy. This last visit 3 weeks ago we waited over an hour for our lunch... SLOW!

xMc4Ga23PYYfH_hLbssbjw.text: I love love this place! My first time here was great and it made me want to come back. I went here recently for the second time and the lobster tacos are soooooo good. Also, my friends and i shared a punch bowl with Vegas Vices! That drink is sweet but delicious. This place is one of my favorite food places to eat whenever i'm in town

XLw72mE5zyDFmG8-sjYh0A.text: We were seated promptly and sat outside by the rail. We ordered the trash can nachos. Not very impressed. It seemed like they had been premade sitting in the kitchen. Not very warm.

VMXlyp_2LOYRxbH3JlNInA.text: My husband and I sat at the bar in which the service was very very relaxed.  Never a priority.  Ordered the trash can nachos which were boring at best.  Also ordered the stuffed jalapeno's in which we couldn't eat because they were so spicy, the filling fell out it was so greasy and the bacon came right off.  We were very disappointed as we were excited to hang at this joint.

ENWnM2nONzAtUnURNGhMqg.text: Let me start by saying that this burger was super flavorful and delicious! If it weren't for our server we would have gone 4 starts for sure! We got the Mac n cheese burger and it was amazing! The server acted as though we were inconveniencing him every time we talked to him.

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VUdBxIgGWsfeK6i0nCtY8w.text: We are big fans of Triple D so we're excited to try Guy's restaurant but we're a bit underwhelmed.  We just missed breakfast so ate lunch instead. A table of 3 and we all felt our meals were ok but nothing stood out as amazing. We had the Motley Cue, Mayor of Burgertown and Brisket entree. The fries come with a mix of 3 or so different types which were decent. The Bloody Mary is delicious and has good toppings. Another table had the nachos which looked awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious Bloody Mary!

sUm1dACGcNH1Ox9KWIsqkQ.text: Based on the Trashcan Nachos and friendly waitstaff I give this a 5 star review. I wast able to try any other dishes unfortunately.

nzUG6xjPhiAqUXrmWZBuEA.text: Guy's Hair is Fogging up his pricing on the menus everything is minimum 20$ and doesnt even Have the wow factor to say it was worth it for him

Rn7EX05V9VDuCrQ5Cj71gg.text: Is a pub, the food was well seasoned and sloppy to eat.  The staff was great.  If you are looking for an eatery....not the place to go.  If you want pub fare, is a fair place.

QijYP3K2VKbR2t5iSIV_JA.text: Service was great. Food was like any other American food diner, over priced for the little amount of food you get. But I guess you pay for the name? I left still hungry after a long day! So we went over to Margaritaville food was super amazing there and huge portions a huge bang for your buck made 2 meals out of my plate there in Margaritaville!! I won't return return to guy Fieri's !

oefd2xJJHCursbgsm1P07g.text: Yo this Guy is fieri's las Restautrant in Vegas. Cool red neck / rock a billy / future cowboy / kid rock decor. Trash can nachos was dope.

wKwtrI0OeJbo5XAjPHby_w.text: So excited to be here. My friend shared original burger. The bbq sauce was fabulous. The side salad had ranch dressing. Honestly dressing needs to be taken up a notch. Only okay   Burger yummy. Lobster tacos very good.

photos.caption: Photo of Guy Fieri's Vegas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YO1GT0lbFwTpSuz2DHkeIQ.text: Awesome joint! My friend and I split the nachos and macaroni and cheese burger...  both dishes were phenomenal and left us in a food coma! We learned at the restaurant that there is a special chef that specializes in just cheese for the nachos... it's a must to try this app, you won't regret it! The waiter was also very friendly and helpful in making our food and drink decisions; he told us what beers went best with each dish we were considering. Would highly suggest!

L-9AwW2Gsv53iYlA2VJOSw.text: Absolutely terrible! Waited for 30 mins for a table only to have a salad with brown lettuce and the driest chicken ever!!! The waiter handled everything well- he was polite and on his game- not his fault the kitchen sucks!

MytVQAgBMhEGoM-sVVLj4Q.text: We've been here a couple times and I was surprised at how good the food was. I'm not a fan of Guy's and when my family wants to eat here I always shut it down. This time they won. I was on my way to a show and they got is in and out with time to spare. I had the Vegas fries since I wasn't super hungry. They were a huge serving and too much for me to eat alone. They come with a side of buffalo sauce you can pour over and a side of blue cheese wasabi. I hate wasabi the they hit a sweet spot of just the right amount of blue cheese and wasabi. My dad had the ringer burger. He enjoyed it. I've had it in the past and I liked it. The only complaint I have with burgers at any of Guy's restaurants is they smash the burgers. I hate that. I love burgers and eat them all the time. A great medium rare burger is my favorite thing to eat but you can't have that when it's smashed.

01CFnM2ib6dt97qmbZUW2w.text: I will start off by saying the food itself was good and tasty. Pricing-wise, it is in line for a tourist place on the Las Vegas strip.  The service however, was lacking. The hostess  had no personality and seemed to not even want to be there. I thought the staff would reflect Guy's outgoing personality. As we waited for our table, there was no chatting, or even asking how we are doing and I don't think she even made eye contact. Just chewed her gum and went about her business. Definitely needs better training or a better personality. (this was on April 12, 2018 around 9pm)  Overall the staff seemed blah. Our waiter was friendly, though not super attentive in checking back with us. Food came out correctly for my fellow friends, but mine was not. They did however fix it somewhat. The water guy was on point though, which is good! Hate being thirsty. Kudos to him.   Overall for the food, I think it was 4 stars for taste. But for the price/service/dining experience, I'm rating 2 stars, since that's just as important. Hopefully they improve and I think his place will be great!

jKJXcDVwS4lEEeOpItCihQ.text: I visited this restaurant for the first time this past Thu. and the food was delicious, along with the service. Decided to go back Saturday evening since i was craving their Mac'n'Cheese Burger. Got to the host and we were told the wait would be 25 minutes, it was 3 of us. 2 of us decided to go to the rr in the meantime...Once we were out we got seated (was so happy we had no actual wait time) As we sat, i recognized the waiter who took care of us on  Thu, told him i recognized him etc he then proceed to go inside (we sat outside) Next thing you know i see another worker storming towards us, he stated he was refusing our service and we had to leave! We were beyond dumbfounded as we had literally sat down! We asked what the reason was, he refused to state any reason besides he was refusing our service. He was very rude and just kept ranting we had to leave and he was refusing service. We then walked out and asked to speak to the manager...he was the manager! He then went out and we politely asked for the reason and he just stated you need to stop harassing my staff, you are being disruptive and cursing! all lies!! we literally were there for no more than 10 minutes, told the waiter we recognized him and then suddenly got kicked out! this was an overall very humiliating experience. Despite the good food i have no desire to go back due to the lack of customer service coming from the manager!!!!!

iEZiaA5dGiPphbj7g2NvoA.text: Never judge a book by its cover.  I did, and paid the price.  Here's the issue, Guy Fiere is a genius,  not so much the kitchen staff.  If you're going to work for Guy Fieri, get on the ball!  This restaurant should be a solid 5 star.  The ribs were cold, and dry.  Unacceptable!  Sorry Guy, what happens in Vegas stays in Vegas, just not this review.

ToAqE4F4thdHwsHznWSPwg.text: Yum!!! My mom and I shared the bbq bourbon wings and the Mac n cheese bacon burger with quad fries.. everything was delicious! Staff was friendly and on top of everything. Highly recommend eating here during your next visit to the strip!
